metal, conforming comfortably to the face.  They are each set with
Swarovski crystals and tie behind the head with a delicate satin ribbon. 
Upon confirmation of your contribution, you’ll be given your choice of
different 3 styles. For more images: http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=561$50 Fishnet Gloves: Add
that little something extra to catch his eye with these long, elegant fishnet
gloves.  The fine mesh is made soft to the touch and stretchy for
all-evening wear by the confident, alluring woman.      $50 Fleur de Nuit
Robe: A simple, sexy memento, these robes are made with a polyblend. The
FDN logo is embroidered on the right side.  They were first sourced as
uniforms for our models to wear over bra and panty sets while serving as
hostesses at our events. However, the reaction to them was so overwhelmingly
positive that we kept them around as an entry point to some of our finer
lingerie. This crowd-funding campaign is your opportunity to get your limited
run of these, as we will not be selling them in the store! For larger and more images: http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=578$100 Geisha
Handcuffs: Luxury bondage – Get yourself cuffed in the name of love with
these delicate Chantilly lace handcuffs. The Geisha Handcuffs (available in
ivory or black) are a feminine, racy treat for in the boudoir. Wear them alone
as an accessory, or hook the detachable dazzling Swarovski crystal beaded chain
to create glamorous handcuffs. $125 Caluna Lacquer
Dress: The Caluna Lacquer dress is a seductive statement that successfully
mixes sexy and romantic in a very tempting alchemy. Made from ‘wet look’
fabric, this dress is a serious look but very wearable.  The material
feels soft and supple against the skin, but breathes easily, never causing
perspiration like leather or latex.  Best of all, it’s completely machine
washable, making garment care a dream.  Suitable for inner or outerwear, the
abundance of laces give a feminine grace to this powerful look.$150 Geisha Handcuffs
& Blindfold: Absolutely exquisite, this delicate Chantilly lace
blindfold and handcuff set is truly a tribute to love and romance. Embellished
with Swarovski crystals and satin ribbon, she’ll feel spoiled in luxury while
in complete surrender.  (available in black or ivory)$250 Aida Robe: The
Aida collection is the embodiment of innocence and elegance.  The silk
satin lace is smooth against the skin and handmade from a romantic floral
patterned lace with matching pure silk satin trimmings. Delicately sensual
& totally gorgeous, it’s perfect for the sophisticated bride. Made to order
in London.
(*Matching g-string, soft bra, garter, or bodysuit available for an extra
charge upon request.) For more images: http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=546 $450 Josephine
Harness Set: Made from luxurious stretch satin and sexy sheer Chantilly
lace, this shoulder harness attaches to the knickers with a detachable waist
harness. Beautifully tailored collar with gold metal trims opens at back of
neck with button detail. Fully smooth and wearable by day or ready for an
unexpected twist at night. Made in the U.K. For more image http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=595$650 Stardust Chemise
& Knickers: We simply cannot take our eyes off this dazzling halterneck
chemise, so we’re pretty sure that whoever has the pleasure of seeing you in it
will have their breath taken away, too.  Two layers of luxurious silk
chiffon flow gloriously from the silk chiffon-tied halterneck neckline,
encrusted with sparkling clear Swarovski crystals. Matching sidetie knickers
complete the ensemble. Handmade in Germany. Blindfold and wrist ties not
included, but available. Black or ivory. For more images http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=602$850 Marine Dress: This
fantastic figure-hugging long lacquer dress is the perfect blend of femininity
and authority.  You’ll be sure to steal the show at any exclusive party.
The ‘wet look’ fabric in this dress wears and breathes like a second skin. The
drop waist falls into layers of lace and tulle – light, flowing and
comfortable.  It can be worn with or without a brief… It’s your game. Each
garment is made to order in France. For more images: http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=614


$1500 Muse Corset
& Sidetie Knickers: Each Felice Art Couture piece is a handmade work of
art out of Germany, aiming to put old-school glamour back into luxury
lingerie.  This corset is sheer polka dot tulle, laid over a satin
silk lining and supported by steel boning. The hem is intricately embroidered
and beaded with Swarovski crystals with a thousand
details making it definitely charming and tempting. Beautiful
lines in this piece accentuate the curves at the top and slim the waist. For more images http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=619
$3500 Divine Diva
Robe: The crowning jewel of the Fleur de Nuit collection, this Felice Art
Couture robe is every inch the dream it looks.  Made from georgette, lined
with 100% whisper-pink satin silk, and trimmed with ostrich feathers, this robe
graces the boudoirs of an exclusive group of women. It flows with the same
grace and elegance down the runway that it does in the quiet evening hours
dressing for dinner or waiting for a lover. For more images http://fleurdenuitaustin.com/?page_id=627Once the campaign is complete, we will send out a form to collect your size and color preferences. Don't hesitate to contact us here with any questions. We're standing by to help.Thank you for your support! - Laura Cuttill

story:
Welcome to Katya’s Collection

I want to start a curated online boutique that offers unique, affordable statement pieces and basics for the modern woman.  Katya's Collection will be an alternative to the shops at the mall and will carry interesting commercially made items as well as handmade goods made by myself and other designers.  Katya's Collection buys from underrepresented and previously unknown independent designers, providing clothing that is affordable and unique, while supporting the efforts of local or small-scale artisans.  With the additional funds I would be able to buy more sizes, allowing me to expand my collection to include plus sizes.

 

I already have a number of online presences, but I would love to consolidate them into a standalone website and (fingers crossed) physical location(s). I am primarily creating and seeking out my own items; with this campaign I would have the means to seek out designers and exclusive items that not only boost the notice of the designer, but provide the buyer with an item that simply does not exist anywhere else.

How I Will Give Back

●      I will donate 5% of my net profits to a non-profit in the area based on your votes (see below).

●      I will donate hats to a to be determined women’s shelter in the area (see below).

●      I want to carry extended sizes whenever possible, because all women deserve excellent clothing choices.

●      I will curate a collection including clothing/accessories from designers in the community, and keep prices affordable.

What I Need

I am asking for $2,500 for three reasons:

      To build an inventory of unique items so that the mission of the boutique can be realized.

●

story:
10 Shades. 1 Mission.

The idea behind KAHMUNE (com · mune) was born in February 2016. Whilst browsing social media in search of “nude” clothes and accessories, I noticed that the term always drew the same results. Although I was in search of items that matched my dark skin tone, all I kept coming across were the same beige and  tan shades. It was overtly clear that “nude” had a type, and my complexion didn't fit the bill. Adamant about having a true nude shoe for my skin tone, I settled for  purchasing a pair of white heels and painting them. Though I loved the result, It didn't feel right that I would have to go to such lengths. I realised that if I was having an issue with the lack of availability, there had to be many other women out there feeling the same way.  KAHMUNE was born as a long overdue solution to the age-old idea that "nude" is one colour. All shades are beautiful and as such they all deserve to be recognised.

I have made it my mission to redefine nude from this:    

To this:

 

"Nude" items hav

As seen in:

 

 

 

 

 

A Nude for All.

I settled on 10 skin tone hues in order to provide all women with a true nude option. Each shade is named after a city or region in the world that inspired it.

 

1. Edinburgh

 

2. Singapore

 

3. Goa

 

4. Bogotá

 

5. Rio

 

6. Gaborone

 

7. Enugu

 

8. Kumasi

 

9. Douala

 

10. Juba

 

We've matched our 10 shades to 3 of the most popular foundations on the market to ensure that you don't have to go far to find your perfect match.

 

 

 

Our Goal.

We have been operating on a made-to-order basis since July 2017. Although it has been amazing to create true nudes just as our customers would like them, each order has come with a 4-6 week wait time. With the funds from this campaign, our goal is to be fully stocked for summer. You order. We ship within 24 hours.

We debuted with two styles, the Becky Pump and the Lucy Sandal. Becky is a classic, so we can't let her go but we'd like to begin offering 3 heel heights to offer our customers: 110mm, 90mm, and 70mm.

Becky Pump

Lucy has been a hit as well, but we're giving her a facelift. Our original style was equipped with a  20 mm strap. Lucy 2.0? It's up to you! We want you to be involved. At the completion of the campaign we will allow all those who have contributed to dictate and then vote on what our Spring/Summer 2018 sandal will look like. You decide everything from the heel shape, heel height, sandal width, and strap styles. 

Lucy Sandal 2.0

 

Flat Styles

Choose from one of our recently introduced flat styles. 

Afua Slide

 

Kennedy Flat

 

Tasha Mule

 

Leather Goods

Because we all love a good leather accessory. Choose from our limited edition leather goods to match your shoes. Our cardholders are unisex and and our totes are the perfect go-to for all of your daily carry-all needs.

story:
Strictly Professionals Fashion Show



Welcome and thank you for viewing my project!


My name is Marisa Fortes and I am a Rider University Student. Starting as an Accounting major (with a behind the scenes love for the arts and entertainment) I took a leap and applied for an internship with Sony Music. After obtaining this internship and seeing that I can realistically use my business background with my passion, I began to think bigger! Having a natural charisma, entrepreneur heart and overly self motivated work ethic, I began gaining connections and experience. Soon I decided I wanted to do my own outside projects. After participating in the coordination of a few fashion shows, I decided this is something I want to accomplish on my own!

Having a wide network of friends, young and old ;-) (or more mature). I wanted to be able to bring my talented peers and my already established friends to one place. I want my peers to have a chance to showcase their talents to everyone and to gain exposure. I always noticed that networking events in colleges were dry and sometimes uncomfortable. The idea of a fashion show is to be in a relaxed environment, FILLED WITH TALKING POINTS but it will be "Strictly Professional". The idea is to have ASPIRING models, fashion designers, musicians and photographers etc, come together to be able to gain exposure and experience.

This show is not limited to a certain race or genre of fashion or music. As my network is wide and diverse, this show will possess the same qualities. Everyone will be able to come together and produce something positive as well as progressive. This will not only be entertainment but something that everyone can gain from and have something to build their futures. You never know who you can meet. I will be reaching out and beyond to get my peers the exposure that they deserve!


What We Need

At this time the biggest expense is the venue and it will be in New York. The goal that I have is what will be enough to cover this expense. Although I would not mind if I raised over the goal. =D I will keep everyone posted on facebook the more specific details.

www.facebook.com/strictlyPro2014

The Impact

The impact will be great! My dream is to genuinely help my peers have a venue to creatively and freely express themselves. This is a way that I can use my business, planning, organization, strategy and most importantly creative skills to allow others to showcase their abilities. This is a forum where it is impossible for their to be anything but love within this venue, everyone has something that they bring to the table. The better part about that fact is that what everyone is bringing to the table is also what they are passionate about! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute financially PLEASE share this on your pages! Any social networking pages, word of mouth, work/school conversations, etc! www.facebook.com/strictlyPro2014
  • Also you can get involved in the show or come and support!
  • If you (or someone you know) would like to be involved in anyway from behind the scenes to preforming, e-mail me! (mlfortes426@me.com)
  • If you are a professional in your field and would like to join to view talent chosen by myself and other peers in my team, feel free to e-mail me! (mlfortes426@me.com)
  • OR If you just think this is a good idea, think that I'm a motivated person that you would love to keep in contact with, help you in the future with your future goals! I love networking and meeting new people.

Marisa Fortes

mlfortes426@me.com

www.facebook.com/strictlyPro2014

story:
HOPSCOTCH VINTAGE + HANDMADE:

Hopscotch Handmade sells vintage goods and makes bowties, neckties, and pocketsquares from vintage materials. 

What We Need & What You Get

What funds will go to:

  • Funds to book Flea Market Space.
  • Display fixtures and stands for vending and photography.
  • Packing and Branding Materials.
  • Business registration fees  and accounting guidance.
  • Funds for gathering more inventory.
  • Advertisements.
With any donation $100 or more you get monthly Hopscotch Handmade Goods delivered to your recipient of choice. Check out the specifics under the perks section! Although a donation of any amount is wonderful ofcourse!

The Impact

So...Why support Hopscotch Vintage + Handmade? You will be supporting and helping to kickstart a company that:

  • Sustainable Fashion: I only sell vintage items and salvage vintage fabrics to make into new accessories (Bowties, neckties, pocket squares etc.). The US alone produces so much clothing a year and reusing/salvaging clothing has a positive impact on the amount of waste we produce.
  • Small Business: One of a kind limited quantity goods made from salvaged and deadstock materials.
  • Queer and Women owned Business: Let's work to break down body negativity and gender restraints in fashion!
  • So far I have been booked with the Artists & Fleas in Williamsburg, an Etsy Sellers Event, the BK Night Bazaar, and the Holiday Bust Craftacular. Each flea market day must be paid for in advance and in order to be able to sell during the holiday season, I need funds to book these market days.
  • I have currently been paying out of pocket, but in order to really get Hopscotch Vintage off the ground I need more funds. Your contribution would allow me to: 
                    - Pay for business registration fees
                    - Purchase necessary display stands and fixtures to be a competitive                             vendor at markets and take eye catching photos for the online shop.
                   - Book flea market vendor spaces through the holiday season before the                         application deadlines.
                    - Create branding materials for packaging and advertisements.

Challenges

There is a lot of competition out there for online business. In the sea of other shops it is a challenge to be seen. Your funds will help me to market Hopscotch Vintage and create a larger fan base of customers. 

Funds raised will help create my branded packaging which will make my ties more desirable for being featured in blogs/magazines, sold in shops, and incorporated into companies that create monthly box memberships.


Other Ways You Can Help

I know that money is tight for a lot of folks. Even if you can't help out financially, there are lots of other ways to support Hopscotch Vintage + Handmade:

  • SPREAD THE WORD - Posting my shop link, facebook page, or this campaign on social media helps me tremendously. As I mentioned, one of the hardest battles in being mostly an online store is being found/having people know about the shop.
  • SHARE YOUR KNOWLEDGE - Know of any good flea markets I should check out? Any organizations or blogs that might be good to try to work with? Know a good accountant? Email me at hpsctchvintage@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

Introducing to some, reconnecting to others, and reaching out to YOU...I am Charles Fitzpatrick:

Formally trained as an engineer, lawyer, and business owner/manager by the finest institutions in the land, including The School of Life and Hard Knocks

Small Business Strategist

Serial Entrepreneur...and my new venture is COCK AND OWL.

COCK AND OWL was born in my mind and has been articulated through design by my nephew Michael Thomas. The premise is simple: First one woke (i.e. The Cock), Last one sleep(i.e. The Owl). It is the brand for those who hustle, those who do what it takes, those who put in the long hours to make sure that dreams become reality when the sun comes up and until it goes down.

COCK AND OWL will begin with t-shirts and progressively move into expanding its fashion line to include diverse wear for the people that find themselves waking up early and going to bed late and need clothes to reflect their versatility and their ability to slip in and out of any environment. We are classic and timeless. 

In this campaign, we are seeking to raise funding for some of our overhead costs in replacing laptop equipment for our creative director(Michael Thomas), to upgrade our design software, and purchase our exclusive inaugural t-shirts.

In investing in our campaign, you get two wins:

  • You have the internal satisfaction of having supported someone near and dear to you, or someone who is close to someone near and dear to you.
  • You get the first shirt which is only being made in limited quantity and it is sure to fetch you a bunch of stares and inquiries...and some monetary appreciation when the line takes off!

We are readying to launch our website and store when this campaign ends, so you can help us with this last step!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $3000 for the purchase of a design-friendly laptop, an upgrade to our design software, and purchase of our first shirts! For every $30 you give, you receive a shirt and a download of the CD of our COCK AND OWL mascot, the Reddot Committee! Check them out here: 

Please note that we consider your contribution an investment, not a donation.  You will receive our very first, exclusive, original shirt...it will certainly appreciate in value!

Why now? COCK AND OWL symbolizes freedom, liberation, change, forward movement. Instead of just talking about resolutions, make a statement with your dollar that you are going to do what it takes, even if it means being the first one woke, last one sleep. You will receive you shirt by the beginning of March and can wear your proclamation with pride all year!

 

The Impact

COCK AND OWL is not just about t-shirts and fashion: it is about lifestyle. Everything worth having demands sacrifice. People who represent and wear COCK AND OWL get that. Do you? Invest now!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, please spread the word to your friends, loved ones, and affiliates! For your convenience, Indiegogo provides a number of share tools. If you believe you can and want to provide any other in-kind support, please contact us. We welcome your investment!

COCK AND OWL was born in my mind and has been articulated through design by my nephew Michael Thomas. The premise is simple: First one woke (i.e. The Cock), Last one sleep(i.e. The Owl). It is the brand for those who hustle, those who do what it takes, those who put in the long hours to make sure that dreams become reality when the sun comes up and until it goes down.
COCK AND OWL will begin with t-shirts and progressively move into expanding its fashion line to include diverse wear for the people that find themselves waking up early and going to bed late and need clothes to reflect their versatility and their ability to slip in and out of any environment. We are classic and timeless. 
In this campaign, we are seeking to raise funding for some of our overhead costs in replacing laptop equipment for our creative director(Michael Thomas), to upgrade our design software, and purchase our exclusive inaugural t-shirts.
In investing in our campaign, you get two wins:

You have the internal satisfaction of having supported someone near and dear to you, or someone who is close to someone near and dear to you.
You get the first shirt which is only being made in limited quantity and it is sure to fetch you a bunch of stares and inquiries...and some monetary appreciation when the line takes off!

We are readying to launch our website and store when this campaign ends, so you can help us with this last step!


 
What We Need & What You Get
We are seeking $3000 for the purchase of a design-friendly laptop, an upgrade to our design software, and purchase of our first shirts! For every $30 you give, you receive a shirt and a download of the CD of our COCK AND OWL mascot, the Reddot Committee! Check them out here: 
Please note that we consider your contribution an investment, not a donation.  You will receive our very first, exclusive, original shirt...it will certainly appreciate in value!
Why now? COCK AND OWL symbolizes freedom, liberation, change, forward movement. Instead of just talking about resolutions, make a statement with your dollar that you are going to do what it takes, even if it means being the first one woke, last one sleep. You will receive you shirt by the beginning of March and can wear your proclamation with pride all year!


 
The Impact
COCK AND OWL is not just about t-shirts and fashion: it is about lifestyle. Everything worth having demands sacrifice. People who represent and wear COCK AND OWL get that. Do you? Invest now!


 
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this time, please spread the word to your friends, loved ones, and affiliates! For your convenience, Indiegogo provides a number of share tools. If you believe you can and want to provide any other in-kind support, please contact us. We welcome your investment!

story:
"A tribe is a group of people connected to one another... and connected to an idea." SG

TR*BE = Textiles Recycled * Benefiting Everyone

@ TR*BE we are the first of our kind, a "green" online mall STARRING YOU - our future Members.

If you send us your most stylish "used" clothing we will keep track of your sales and you will receive a substantial store credit or cash when your items sell.

 

So here's the plan.

We are asking for donations so that we can show investors that there is interest out there in a company like TR*BE.  We need seed funding to pay our staff to build us this incredible new social network.

While we don't want to give away too much concerning the social network - we can tell you that we are taking our favorite aspects of etsy, pinterest, facebook, and reddit - and throwing them into a pot in order to cook up an online experience that will be truly, well... NEW!

The Impact

Our goal in starting TR*BE was to find a way to help fund important global causes while also being able to provide a service that people actually want.  This is the company we wish existed, but didn’t, until now.

@ TR*BE a substantial percentage of our profits will be given away to help fund important global causes related to extreme poverty in the third world.  Just how much? Well, you'll have to become a member to find out (it's a lot).

@ TR*BE our goal is to provide the best online shopping experience the world has ever seen, while offering our members garments they will feel proud to wear.

@ TR*BE we want to make our members lives better by giving you a way to capitalize off of the clothes you own - and honestly, if we can give some money away in the process to the people who need it most - well - that's just icing on the cake!  We do it gladly. 

Remember - this aint a guilt trip. It's a party bus.  Ya dig?

We hope you understand – this is a big idea.  We know.  We want to be the next step in the evolution of the fashion industry. 

Please consider donating financially to TR*BE so that we can provide you with a shopping experience unlike any other. 

TR*BE = Textiles Recycled * Benefiting Everyone

We are sick of wondering where our money is going.

We are tired of settling for what today's corporations are offering. 

We want more. 

We want to be better.

We want to blur the line between new and recycled. 

We want to look good while doing good.

We want to get - by giving. 

So hello.  Nice to meet you. 

We hope this will be the start of a beautiful relationship.

*There is no I in TR*BE.


 
 
*The organizations we contribute to have been carefully selected not only for their excellent scores by international charity rating organizations, but for exhibiting a dedication to empowering those individuals they serve through grassroots, education based programs that treat those in need as fellow men and women, with dignity, knowing that they are just as capable as anyone, if given the proper tools, to sustain and care for their own.

story:
How would you like to hold two spheres of the same size, one more than nine times heavier than the other? Do you want to see some of the rarest laminated metals on the planet? Would you like to relax by circling two smooth spheres in the palm of your hand?

 

Here’s your chance!

Introducing the BilletSPIN Sphere collection

Each Sphere is .98" in diameter and comes with its own stand made of brass.

Perfectly sized for any desk, these won’t take over your workspace but are still large enough for the detail to shine.

Every Sphere and stand is proudly machined with care in our shop in America’s heartland.

Choose from 15 materials: 8 standard metals, 6 layered exotics, and a superconductor.

Whatever you choose, BilletSPIN Spheres gleam with simple elegance that's sure to draw attention.

Stretch Goal Reached!

I thought I had more time but due to the amazing support I will release this new option now: The Zirconium Sphere!! Machined, polished and flamed dark gray/black. Weighing in at 55grams. Here is your chance to own this element. This sphere is NOT included in the whole enchilada. 

Standards

Varied finishes highlight the natural beauty of the material while giving each metal a distinct look. From magnesium, the lightest option, to tungsten, the heaviest, the materials also vary widely in weight. Take a look at the differences!

Exotics

The 6 layered exotic Spheres are made of mokume, Damascus and Timascus. The superconductor, also an exotic, is copper with niobium rods. We'll get into more detail below, but in short, these highly sought-after materials are time-consuming, expensive, and extremely difficult to make. Once we receive these materials from our suppliers, we machine them into the round shape, accenting the beauty of each unique combination.  

Get to know the exotics

Timascus- Consists of two or more titanium alloys laminated and patterned resembling steel Damascus. The various alloys color differently through the use of heat or anodizing. Each type of titanium alloy has the potential for a new color combination.

Damascus- Two different grades of stainless steel that are forged together to make specific patterns. Once machined and polished, we acid etch these to bring out the breathtaking pattern hidden in the materials.

Mokume- Decorative metal that is made by fusing different non-ferrous metals together through heat and pressure. Our 2-color mokume uses nickel silver and copper layers, while the 3-color uses nickel silver, copper, and brass.

Superconductor- Superconductors are materials that conduct electricity without electrical resistance, which dissipates the charge. Our superconductor Sphere is made from copper and has 444 rods of niobium running through it. 

In depth video of all 15 variations:

About Us

My name is Rich Stadler. I've been a machinist for over 25 years, and for me, there is nothing better than finding what is hiding in a raw bar of material. My passion for creating functional art with metal drove me to start BilletSPIN in March, 2015. This year, it became my full-time job. Being able to bring my work to you in this way is an incredible blessing.

From the start, we've machined all of our products in our family-owned shop located in Wisconsin. Thanks to our customers, BilletSPIN has grown, and so has the team supporting it. A variety of individuals from machinists to a graphic designer now come together to ensure BilletSPIN continues to offer top of the line products made and launched with the same kind of passion that started this company in the first place.

If you would like to stay up to date with future designs and all things BilletSPIN related, check out our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/391445661039396/

Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxZbMn2n7KTg83...

Website: www.billetspin.com

or follow @Billetspin_tops on Instagram

Our Past Projects

BilletSPIN launched with a Kickstarter campaign called Billet Dice. The project succeeded, and we completed fulfillment within a month of the end of the campaign. Next, we introduced precision tops. Due to the popularity of the tops, we started making other top designs every few weeks and selling them in a group called Pocket Top Talk. We also did a Kickstarter last year called Worry Tokens. On Indiegogo, we launched precision tops Navigator and K2. Our most popular seller to date, the K2 raised over $400,000. We completed fulfillment of the K2 in 6 weeks after the end of the campaign. 

How to order BilletSPIN Spheres

Ready to order? On the right side of the page, you will see a list of perks. Move your mouse over the perk you would like to receive. Click on "Get this perk." Fill out your information and click "Submit payment." Feel free to purchase as many perks as you like.

After placing you order, just sit back and relax. Once the campaign ends, we will begin shipping. The only other thing we ask is for you to accept our sincerest gratitude. Thank you so much for your support.

We are here if you have any questions! Just click to envelope icon toward the top of the page to message us.

Fulfillment

This is our 6th crowdfunding campaign. In the past, we have shipped a good portion of the perks before we ourselves got paid. Unfortunately, due to the prices of these exotic materials, we will have to wait to order them until the campaign is almost over. This means delivery is expected in March, 2017, which is a little further out than usual for us, but the Spheres are worth the wait!

story:
The $45k covers the minimum shoes and shoe boxes for US size 6, 7, 8, and 9.  When we hit $70k we can add shoe sizes 5 and 10, including the molds needed for those shoe sizes.  Anything over $70k will be used to get half sizes.

The Journey

Hey everyone... I'm just your average guy with an idea... well an idea and the drive to see it become a reality.  High Pheels started a year and a half ago, on Leap Day, when a friend flew down and packed an entire suitcase full of high heel shoes.  I thought that was absolutely insane, "why not just have one shoe and change out the skins?"  That's when my light bulb went off, and after hundreds of prototypes and every little piece of feedback I could get from high heel experts (women), here we are with a full line of skins and currently manufacturing the most comfortable, yet fashionable pair of high heels in the market.  This is where we need your help.

We are transitioning from an accessories company, into a full blown shoe company and need to raise money to get the minimums from our manufacturer.  Because we are doing new things in this industry, we need to get new molds, dies, and all other equipment to produce our shoes.  All the money we raise will go into getting the minimums and the new tooling needed to manufacture our shoes.

 

That's me =)

 High Pheels (pronounced peels) are interchangeable skins for high heel shoes.  The way I have designed them, they change the color of the outer shoe and also line the inside of the shoe with fabric, helping to prevent rubbing/blisters on the feet.  High Pheels come in two sizes Small and Medium.  Smalls fit shoe sizes 5-7.5 and Mediums fit sizes 8-10.5.

  • fit on closed toe platform pump
  • no shoe modification
  • does not require glue, magnets, etc.
  • spandex/nylon fabric
  • designed to change the outer color, while lining the inside of the shoe
  • increases comfort
  • machine washable  

           

                       

 

How are our shoes different?

As you can clearly see, our shoes come with extra padding and a gel insole already built into the shoe for added comfort.  Not to mention that they come with a pair of Red High Pheels, so you have your option of a black shoe or put the Pheel on to make it a red shoe.


What colors are available?

We have 21 different colors to choose from (listed by colors, top to bottom, left to right)

Smalls fit shoes 5-7.5 and Mediums fit shoes 8-10.5

Cheetah, Peacock, Zebra, Houndstooth, Lightning, Newspaper, Sequins Black, Sequins Blue, Sequins Pink, Sequins Red, Sequins Silver, Solid Blue, Solid Cream, Solid Pink, Solid Red, Solid White, Sparkly Fuchsia, Sparkly Gold, Sparkly Pink, Sparkly Red, Sparkly Silver

story:
Hi there! and a very warm welcome to the Punkin Shoe Project!

This campaign to to help raise funds to buy in bulk shoes and accessories, if our goal is reached this means cutting customer waiting times.

In may 2013 after becoming self employed the previous month I made (as many people in my field of work do) a spontaneous decision, little known to me that that one idea would completely change the face and workings of my business!
That decision was to customize a pair of old boots i'd had for a while, my usual work would consist of jewelry and accessories and i never thought that in the following weeks I would completely commit myself to making bespoke and awesome shoes!
needless to say the response to my shoes was phenomenal and i'm now working full time from my home bringing you unique and individual shoes made to order and completely customized

The only back fall to this, is shoes take a lot of effort to complete and turnover times can get a lil hefty some months so i'd like to start a campaign to raise enough funds to actually stock some of my design and make them available to buy straight from my website which means customers wanting those designs that are in stock only have to wait the average of 3-7 days as oppose to 28 days for shoes!

This will also enable to be bring a wider variety of themes and shoe styles all ready to ship on order!

story:
The player is able to create his own company in the Athletic shoe industry.

He can create 5 product types and launch it on the market :

Sneaker, football, basketball, soccer and running shoes.

When the player launches a product, there is a competitor on the market. The ultimate goal is to beat all the competitors.

A completed product can be challenged by playing a series of missions :

Strategy

Team management

Marketing and communication

The success of these missions determines the product quality, important for the product performance on the market.

Improve your products with features that will give you advantage over your challengers.

Mobile apps, retailers… Choose the best strategy to sell your products.



Hire the best engineers, designers and marketing executives to run your company and train them.


Make your company a great place to work.


Increase sales with an advertising campaign.


Sponsoring an Event.


I’m a lifelong gamer (tycoon games) who until recently has been leading dual life. By day, working as a financial controller (in the software and game industry), by night as a game creator, making short games with  the excellent tool Multimedia Fusion.

In late 2011, I finally decided to follow my dream to make games full time. I quit my day job and took a training course in graphic & game design.

I have been working on Athletic Shoes Tycoon for the past year, and I've come a long way. Thus far I have covered my expenses by depleting my personal savings accounts and credit cards.

Now, I have a mature project. This is where you come in. Your support will allow me to make a cool game.

Let's make Athletic Shoes Tycoon together, we can do it!

Food: even developers have to eat.

Bills: to minimize costs, I work from my home, but I still have to pay the rent.

Administrative costs related to running a business, plus legal and tax advice.

Iphone support : to release Athletic Shoes Tycoon on this platform, I need to buy a Mac.

Graphics & sound design: I want outsource the production of certain graphics and sounds which is problematic for me, so I can focus on other aspects of the game.

There will be 2 versions of the game. One will be free (lite version) and there will be a second full version that will be paid. Exact price of the full game has not yet been determined but it will be in line with other games of similar quality.

If you can't contribute to our campaign that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please pass on a link to our campaign and spread the word of Athletic Shoes Tycoon.

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About Figments & Filaments II:

Figments & Filaments is a convention celebrating costuming and cosplay in all of its various genres and applications. Whether researching the clothing of a by-gone era, designing costume or make up for stage or screen or the whim of an individual, what one wears can say volumes of not only the times and society that a person identifies with, but also what that person says about themselves and their society. Like a Fun House mirror, our clothes and costumes at once distort and reveal a deeper reality about ourselves.

Figments & Filaments II will be held April 24 - 26, 2015 at the DoubleTree Hilton in Overland Park, KS.
Our Guests of Honor for 2015 include:
  • Professor Gale Owen-Crocker, professor of Anglo-Saxon Culture at The University of Manchester, UK and Director of the Manchester Centre for Anglo-Saxon Studies.  She has a new book coming out and Figments & Filaments will be its United States debut!
  • Matthew Gnagy, author, designer, costume historian, and professional knitter.
  • Robin Netherton, author and editor of historic costuming books, and costume researcher
  • Jillian Venters, author of Gothic Charm School, and the blog of the same name.
Each of the specialists mentioned above holds a valuable piece of the puzzle for many costumers. The historian knows what is right & accurate for a given period. The theatrical designer knows how a costume needs to be presented in a given work, and how to layer that costume with meaning. The living historian knows what it means to live in a particular outfit. We are endeavoring to bring all those pieces in one place, to the benefit to a wider costuming audience.
Figments & Filaments Website

Why a Crowdfunding campaign?

In order to give you the best convention possible, we need to raise funds to cover our expenses and get our guests to the convention. By raising the funds ahead of time, we are able to get the best deals on Guest of Honor plane tickets, secure contracts with the hotel, and purchase our materials ahead of time.

The funds we raise will cover:

  • Hotel costs and fees ($3000 plus taxes and fees). 
  • Guest of Honor transportation, room and board (About $5000)
  • Other expenses such as convention books, badges, guest hospitality, advertising and promotional costs, storage fees, improving gallery space, website upkeep and improvement, purchasing supplies for children's activities, designing and printing T shirts and tote bags, ($1000+)
If we surpass our goal, for every additional $1000, we will be able to invite and bring in another Guest of Honor.

    What perks are we offering?

    $1 - Thank you!     We are very grateful!
    $5 - Let the world know!    We will show our gratitude by listing you as a donor on our website.
    $10 - Bits and Scraps    We will send you a small package of scrap fabric from the 2014 Figments & Filaments Scrap Swap. There will be 3 - 5 scraps included. Sorry, we cannot take requests for colors or fabric types. We will also list you on our website as a contributor.
    $15 - F&F Poster    We will send you a full color poster with the Figments & Filaments logo, and thank you on our website.  The 11 x 17 poster will have this design:

    $25 - F&F Hand dyed tote    These canvas totes have been hand dyed and decorated with stitching and a patch pocket. They are vibrant colors and each one is unique. Only a limited number (14) are available. We will also list you on our web site as a contributor. Sorry, we cannot take requests for specific colors.

    $30 - F&F T Shirt   Show your support with a Figments & Filaments T shirt! The F&F logo in two colors will decorate the front of the shirt. Please let us know what size shirt you would like. You will also be listed on our website as a contributor.  This is the design on the shirt:

    $40 - Basic Convention Membership    Want to come to the convention? Select this perk and get the discount pre-registration amount! It includes entry to all the classes, vendor room, and guest hospitality. The price at the door is a lot more, so pre-purchase your membership and save!
    $60 - Preferred Membership   In addition to getting into the convention, you can get preferred seating in the classes and events like the Fashion Show. You will also get a Figments & Filaments 2015 Tote Bag to carry your convention loot!  We will also give you a special mention in the Convention Book. 
    $80 - VIP Convention Membership    You will get everything in the Preferred Membership level. In addition, you may attend the Guest of Honor Meet and Greet on Friday evening.
    $125 - Photo shoot Membership    In addition to a Basic Membership, our Convention Photographer will schedule an hour-long photo shoot with you. You will get a cd with your photos, as well as a printed 8x10 of your choice. These will be delivered to you after the convention. This perk can be scheduled at a time other than during the convention, and so is for only available to our local members. Our photographer is in the Lawrence area.
    $225 - Fashion Show Diva Membership     In addition to a Basic Membership, we will have a professional stylist and professional make up artist come out to the hotel and do your hair and make up on Saturday afternoon for the Fashion Show. Please inform us of any allergies if you select this perk. Contact us in advance with reference pictures for the hair and make up styles so the artists are ready to help you at the convention. This does NOT include the stylist providing a wig or extensions.
    $300 - Name a Classroom     Do you want to name one of the classrooms at the convention? With this perk, you can. The name you choose will appear on the room, in the convention book, and on the class schedules. A business could even sponsor a classroom. G-rated names ONLY. The name you select is subject to approval by the convention. You may be asked for several choices.
    $375 - Single All Expenses Weekend     With this perk, you get a basic membership, a Figments & Filaments T shirt, a single hotel room at the convention, and food for the weekend. This includes dinner Friday evening, breakfast, lunch, and dinner on Saturday, and breakfast and lunch on Sunday for ONE person. The hotel will provide a menu with the choices for the lunches and dinners.
    $400- Basic Lifetime Membership     At this level, you get a lifetime basic membership to the convention. As long as the convention goes on, you can get in. You will not be affected by any price increases! This membership can NOT be transferred to other people.
    $500 - Weekend Membership for Two     Don't want to worry about going out for meals? This includes two basic memberships, two T-shirts, a double hotel room, and food for two. Food includes dinner on Friday, breakfast, lunch, and dinner on Saturday, and breakfast and lunch on Sunday. The hotel provides a menu for the lunches and dinners.
    $500 - Fashion Show Sponsor     Sponsor our Fashion Show! Saturday night! We will announce you or your business as the sponsor for our fashion show. You will also be listed on the web site as the fashion show sponsor, in the convention book, and on the convention schedule. We will work with you to get the most out of this you can!
    $600 - Lifetime Vendor Membership     Do you want to sell things at Figments & Filaments and not ever worry about a price increase, or whether you get your payment in on time? The Lifetime Vendor Membership is for you. You will get a single vendor space with table every year! Some conditions apply. Not transferable to other vendors, individuals, or businesses. 
    $800 - Lifetime VIP Membership     Every year, from here on out, you will have a VIP membership to Figments & Filaments! This includes entry into the convention, a tote bag, preferred seating at all the classes and events, and entry into the Guest of Honor Meet & Greet. Non transferable and other conditions may apply.

      What do we hope to do?

      We want to foster inclusiveness in the costume and cosplay community.

      Our teachers and Guests of Honor offer both lecture classes and hands-on classes where attendees can make costume pieces to take home with them. We offer an environment where all attendees of all ages and skill levels can talk with each other and learn, network, and explore our love of all things costume!

       We will be expanding our programming at the upcoming convention to include activities and classes for children and youth. These include a Children's Fashion Show and hands-on activities where young people can make their own costume parts and props to take home with them. 

      We want to reach out to colleges and universities locally and around the country and forge relationships with their fashion design and theater departments. If we get enough participation from these groups, we hope to have an intercollegiate costume contest.

      We plan to expand the Costume Gallery and add a Masked Ball after the Fashion Show. We plan to continue activities from last year that people enjoyed such as the Scrap Swap and the Silent Auction.

        Risks & Challenges

        Figments & Filaments 1 was a great success! We are moving to a larger and better-equipped hotel, which requires more of a financial outlay. 

        • As with any convention, there is a risk that a Guest of Honor may get ill and may not be able to attend. We have ideas for Guests to invite if this happens.
        • The larger hotel has larger costs associated with it. We have budgeted for this and are running this campaign to cover these costs.
        • Some of the perks may be mailed after the convention rather than before.


        Want to help more?

        • We love volunteers! Come to the convention and work a couple hours. You'll have our eternal gratitude and get a patch for helping out.
        • Teach a class! We need more teachers and welcome a larger variety of classes. Teachers also get into the Friday Evening Guest of Honor Meet & Greet.
        • Display your work in the Gallery! Have you made a gorgeous outfit that you don't want to wear all day? Display it in our gallery while you attend classes.
        • Host a room party! There will be a prize for the best themed room party.
        • Share this with your friends! Do you know someone who might like to attend, teach, or be a vendor? Share this on your social media and help us connect!
        • Are you a vendor? Would you like to advertise in the convention book? Contact us and we will get you more information.
        • And please share this with your friends and on social media!
        • Figments & Filaments Website

story:
Dear Backers

We're launching the Stilform pen, our unique magnetic ballpoint pen with refined mechanism and the best refill ever made!

Since we released our magnetic ballpoint pen in the very first campaign, it has been a huge success. As our first product, we kept on refining the pen and tweaked every aspect of it while keeping the same award-winning aesthetics.  

We partnered up with the most advanced refill manufacturer - SCHMIDT Technology - to guarantee that our new Stilform pen provides you the best writing experience.

 

 

 

Refined mechanism: From machining tolerances to surface treatment, the improvements are in the details, but nonetheless noticeable.

 

The new Stilform clip is made through high-end Metal Injection Molding and equipped with a unique protection layer that prevents scratching.

 

In collaboration with the renowned German refill manufacturer SCHMIDT Technology, we developed the best ballpoint cartridge on the market for our new Stilform pen. SCHMIDT Technology is known to produce the refills of premium and luxury stationery brands like Mont Blanc and many others. The SCHMIDT x stilform Refill combines the performance of a traditional ballpoint cartridge with a smoother writing experience similar to a rollerball refill.

 

 

 

 You can choose from 6 reward tiers: one for each color option of the pen. 

If you’d like to receive multiple rewards, simply add €45 for every additional Stilform pen to your pledge (view the project's FAQ for pledge examples). Adding another pen color whose reward tier is already out of stock can be possible, as the amount of pens in each color as additional pens was taken into account.  

 

If you'd like to get any of the Stilform accessories below, simply add the respective value to your pledge. The accessories will also be available in the Backerkit survey after the campaign.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Material: grade-6 aluminium, weight: 26 g
  • 1x Black Schmidt x stilform Refill included inside each pen, size M
  • Compatible with all G2 standard refills (Parker-style refills)
  • Matt-laminated premium packaging with white cloth pouch

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

You can reach us by any of these following methods:

1. Back our campaign and leave a comment in the comments section

2. Contact us via Facebook Messenger (click the button below)

3. Contact us via email at info@stilform.com

4. Visit our store: https://www.stilform.com

story:
U.S. Returns and Exchanges:

We will do our best to send you the best fitting and most comfortable shirt through this campaign. However, if you receive a shirt and find out that you will require a different size, please contact us through our email (info@blueandwhitecollar.com) or our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/blueandwhitecollar/). We will inform you on how you can send us the shirt and for us to send you a better fitting size. In this case, we will cover the shipping cost for you to receive the correct size, but due to the small size of our company, you will need to pay for the shipping to send the shirt back.  

We will not accept any returned shirts with tags removed. Shirts damaged after opening the package will also not be accepted. 

If we do send you a defective shirt or simply sent you the wrong size, we will cover all the shipping costs. 

For additional inquiries about returns and exchanges, please email us at info@blueandwhitecollar.com or find us on Facebook and contact our representatives through our Facebook Page: Blue and White Collar.

International Returns and Exchanges:

We will do our best to send you the best fitting and most comfortable shirt through this campaign. However, we understand when you receive a shirt and find out that you will require a different size, please contact us through email or though our Facebook page. We will inform you on how you can send us the shirt and for us to send you a better fitting size. Due to the small size of our company, you will have to cover all shipping costs for the exchange. 

We will not accept any returned shirts with tags removed. Shirts damaged after opening the package will also not be accepted.

If we do send you a defective shirt or simply sent you the wrong size, we will cover all the shipping costs.

For additional inquiries about returns and exchanges, please email us at info@blueandwhitecollar.com or find us on Facebook and contact our representatives through our Facebook Page: Blue and White Collar.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Van Nguyen. I'm currently finishing up my Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Fashion Design at the Art Institute of Seattle, and plan to graduate in December. In order to graduate, however, each Fashion Design major must design and construct a portfolio installation for the mandatory Portfolio Show this December. A portfolio installation consists of original garments, take away catalog, portfolio set, and a visually displayed space.

Each student pays for their materials and supplies out of pocket for every single element. Depending on the materials chosen, a single standard portfolio book cost around $117 to $200, even more for higher quality book and paper quality. One of the most common issues with design students is not having the funds to completely bring our vision to life, to take our creativity above and beyond. To pay for my assignments, along with my parent’s help, I currently work two part-time jobs on top of being a full-time student. I've been fortunate enough to be able to pay for part of my tuition, rent, materials and supplies for my senior collection, food, bus fare, and discretionary activities, but it's not enough. 

To graduate as a fashion designer with a strong portfolio has been my goal since elementary school. Aside from previous years' collections, I have designed and constructed a senior collection of 8 looks total. I was honored to receive Best Runway Look and Designer of the Year awards with the collection from The Art Institute of Seattle’s annual fashion show in March 2014. I am very, very happy and proud to see the work I have achieved so far. It would mean the world to me if I am able continue the work quality that I have been maintaining through out my career.



Where will the Money Go

My goal is to gather $800 in 25 days. Most of the money I receive will be spent first on getting my portfolio together (portfolio binder, paper, business card, printing). Then the rest will go into getting display props for my booth on the day of portfolio in December. If I exceed my initial goal, the money will go back and helps pay for take away gifts, fashion booklets, and perks. Below is a more detailed list of where the donated money will go:

·  Portfolio books

·  Paper and printing

·  Sheet protectors

·  Collection catalog

·  Collection photo book

·  Fashion Creative Zine

·  Take away folders (resume, mini catalog, and business cards)

·  Logo and title board

·  Paint

·  Wood

·  Hardware

·  Visual display materials (table cloth, booth decorations, hangers, backdrop)

The Impact

EMBARK is a collection I designed to honor women of the modern era, who possess a bold personality and an ambition to explore. There is a growing number of young and fearless women who are slowly changing the world, and I would like to embrace and dedicate to this crowd. EMBARK is a mix of bold prints, vibrant color, playful cut, as well as fluid and feminine silhouette. The collection portrayed the diverse beauty of the women who inspired it, and set them free, free to be anything.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk that I might run into is to not be able to raise $800 in 25 days. Within these 25 days, I would have to order my portfolio books, business cards, and staging props so that they could be ready for Portfolio Show at the beginning of December. If I don’t meet my target by November 26th, all the funds donated will still be spent on the production of portfolio, as well as sending all the gifts and perks out between mid-December through mid-January.

The Perks

I have hesitated for a very long time before creating this campaign, and I could never ask for your help without giving back something at the end. Therefore, my campaign comes with several perks! By donating a certain amount, you are qualified to receive certain perks below:

The special “Thank you” Perk

By donating a $1 minimum, your name will appear on the back of the Creative Zine, and you will also receive a personal thank at the end of this campaign.

The Digital Creative Zine Perk


By donating a minimum of $10, you are qualified to receive a downloadable Creative Zine - a 10 – 20 pages booklet featuring my original illustrations, textile designs, and lots of room for your own creativity. Plus all the previous perk!

The Printed Creative Zine Perk

By donating a minimum of $30, you are qualified to receive a color printed Creative Zine, as well as all the previous perks.

The Deluxe Creative Zine + Look Book Perk

By donating a minimum of $50, you are qualified to receive a color printed Creative Zine, plus an extensive EMBARK Look Book, as well as all the previous perks.

The Exclusive VAN NGUYEN Wristlet Perk

By donating a minimum of $100, you are qualified to receive one out of two exclusive VAN NGUYEN bracelet , as well as all the previous perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some just can't contribute, and I understand, but that doesn't mean you can't help out:

  • Words mean millions, tell your community about this campaign and I will be forever thankful for your support. To help, simply post this on your social media page (Facebook, Twitter, etc.).
story_txt:
Short
Summary
Hello! My name is Van
Nguyen. I'm currently finishing up my Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in Fashion
Design at the Art Institute of Seattle, and plan to graduate in December. In
order to graduate, however, each Fashion Design major must design and construct
a portfolio installation for the mandatory Portfolio Show this December. A
portfolio installation consists of original garments, take
away catalog, portfolio set, and a visually displayed space.
Each student pays for their materials and
supplies out of pocket for every single element. Depending
on the materials chosen, a single standard portfolio book cost around $117 to
$200, even more for higher quality book and paper quality. One of the most
common issues with design students is not having the funds to completely bring
our vision to life, to take our creativity above and beyond. To pay for my
assignments, along with my parent’s help, I currently work two part-time jobs
on top of being a full-time student. I've been fortunate enough to be able to
pay for part of my tuition, rent, materials and supplies for my senior
collection, food, bus fare, and discretionary activities, but it's not
enough. 
To graduate as a
fashion designer with a strong portfolio has been my goal since elementary school.
Aside from previous years' collections, I have designed and constructed a senior collection of 8 looks total. I was
honored to receive Best Runway Look and Designer of the Year awards with the
collection from The Art Institute of Seattle’s annual fashion show in March
2014. I am very, very happy and proud to see the work I have achieved so far.
It would mean the world to me if I am able continue the work quality that I
have been maintaining through out my career.Where
will the Money Go
My goal is to gather $800 in 25 days. Most of the
money I receive will be spent first on getting my portfolio together (portfolio
binder, paper, business card, printing). Then the rest will go into getting
display props for my booth on the day of portfolio in December. If I exceed my
initial goal, the money will go back and helps pay for take away gifts, fashion
booklets, and perks. Below is a more detailed list of where the donated money
will go:
·  Portfolio books
·  Paper and printing
·  Sheet protectors
·  Collection catalog 
·  Collection photo book 
·  Fashion Creative Zine
·  Take away folders
(resume, mini catalog, and business cards)
·  Logo and title board 
·  Paint
·  Wood 
·  Hardware
·  Visual display materials
(table cloth, booth decorations, hangers, backdrop)
The
Impact
EMBARK is a collection
I designed to honor women of the modern era, who possess a bold personality and
an ambition to explore. There is a growing number of young and fearless women
who are slowly changing the world, and I would like to embrace and dedicate to
this crowd. EMBARK is a mix of bold prints, vibrant color, playful cut, as well
as fluid and feminine silhouette. The collection portrayed the diverse beauty
of the women who inspired it, and set them free, free to be anything.


Risks
& Challenges
The biggest risk that I might run into is to not be
able to raise $800 in 25 days. Within these 25 days, I would have to order my
portfolio books, business cards, and staging props so that they could be ready
for Portfolio Show at the beginning of December. If I don’t meet my target by November
26th, all the funds donated will still be spent on the production of
portfolio, as well as sending all the gifts and perks out between mid-December
through mid-January.
The Perks
I have hesitated for a very long time before
creating this campaign, and I could never ask for your help without giving back
something at the end. Therefore, my campaign comes with several perks! By
donating a certain amount, you are qualified to receive certain perks below:
The
special “Thank you” Perk
By donating a $1 minimum, your name will appear on
the back of the Creative Zine, and you will also receive a personal thank at
the end of this campaign.
The
Digital Creative Zine PerkBy donating a minimum of $10, you are qualified to
receive a downloadable Creative Zine - a 10 – 20 pages booklet featuring my
original illustrations, textile designs, and lots of room for your own
creativity. Plus all the previous perk!
The
Printed Creative Zine Perk 
By donating a minimum of $30, you are qualified to
receive a color printed Creative Zine, as well as all the previous perks.
The
Deluxe Creative Zine + Look Book Perk
By donating a minimum of $50, you are qualified to
receive a color printed Creative Zine, plus an extensive EMBARK Look Book, as
well as all the previous perks. 
The
Exclusive VAN NGUYEN Wristlet Perk
By donating a minimum of $100, you are qualified to
receive one out of two exclusive VAN NGUYEN bracelet , as well as all the previous perks.
Other
Ways You Can Help
Some just can't contribute, and I understand, but that
doesn't mean you can't help out:

Words mean millions, tell your community about this
     campaign and I will be forever thankful for your support. To help, simply
     post this on your social media page (Facebook, Twitter, etc.).

story:
Meet napo gloves!

 

Stylish and affordable touchscreen gloves made from natural leather. Available for women and men, without luxury markup.

 

Our mission

 

The leather gloves available in the market haven’t change for years – traditional brands, boring design, lack of functionality and high prices.

At napo gloves we aim to change that by offering touchscreen compatible, beautifully designed, high-quality products without luxury markup.

We launched in 2014 and since then we have sold more than 10 000 pairs of gloves. For the upcoming winter season we have designed a brand new, outstanding collection and now, we’re incredibly excited to share what we believe is the best leather gloves out there.

 

Featured in

 

 

 

 

Packaging

Stylish and modern packaging is another reason to get a pair for yourself or as a gift

 

 

Reviews

What our recent customers said about our products

 

Stretch goal

Help us reach it!

 

 

FAQ

 

How to take care of my gloves?

In order to keep your gloves in a perfect condition you should avoid contact with liquids, friction, washing, drying or ironing them.

Will I receive the gloves before Christmas?

Yes, if there will be no unforseen problems, that are out of our control, your pair of napo gloves will arrive before Christmas.

Can I order more than one pair of gloves?

Yes, you can order as many pairs as you want. Delivery costs are charged for every perk, so we recommend our double packs when ordering more than one pair.

Do you ship Worldwide?

We offer worldwide shipping to our International Backers. International shipments may be subject to import taxes, duties and customs fees, which are levied once your package reaches the country of destination, and are the responsibility of the recipient.

Do my gloves have a warranty?

Yes, every pair of napo gloves has a 12 months warranty.

Do you accept returns? What is your return policy?

As we are offering our gloves at highly discounted prices, we won’t be able to accept returns. We will accept exchanges up to 30 days after you receive your gloves, but you will need to cover the two way shipping. The exchange package should include unworn, unbroken gloves with hangtag and packaging.

Do you accept refunds?

Yes, refunds are accepted according to Indiegogo’s refund policy.

What does the cost of shipping cover?

The cost of shipping covers overseas shipping from Europe with postal service. For 90% of locations (USA, Europe, Canada, Australia, etc.) there is a tracking number available.

 

 

napo community

Visit @napogloves on Instagram and explore napo gloves' world!

 

 

 

You can visit us here:

story:
What it is

This shoe is the Lustro shoe, it was designed from an idea and although $1000 may seem like a lot, it isn't, all I need is your help to make this shoe into a reality. After this shoe is successful, I will be creating an even BIGGER campaign on the company, the company will include, pants, shirts, shoes, jackets, hoodies, bags you name it. This entire style will be formed by you.

What I need and what you can get

I am going to need $1000 to make and manufacture the first shoe, I will be giving away the shoe to whomever can generously donate the most amount of money

    Risks & Challenges

    The only risk within this entire campaign is the one that you make it to become, and that's by not investing into this project. This is 100% real and can become an actual shoe once it is made

story:
Let me start with a few words of encouragement that India’s best Wrestler and two-time Olympic medalist Sushil Kumar gave us:

"I'd like to congratulate ‘India For Sports’ for the wonderful concept. Our wrestlers have the capability to win big and this is only possible if the people decide to do something for them"

You can view Olympic Silver and Bronze medalist Sushil Kumar’s testimonial below.


About 'India For Sports'

Behind every great story there are multiple, often small, stories which all get stitched together to make that one central story Big. The success of an athlete is somewhat similar. Behind every successful athlete, there are several others who support them through thick and thin; the family, coach, friends, and sometimes, millions of others who never knew the athlete personally but stood by them when they were in need.

‘India For Sports’ is India's first Not-For-Profit, Athlete-Only, Crowdfunding Organization dedicated to provide a level playing field to the poor and deprived Indian athletes that other athletes across the world have. Even in the 21st century, the idea of modern equipment and use of technology in sports seems too far-fetched for many athletes in India. Many of them do not even have access to adequate nutritious food. There have been multiple studies done on this and this recent article published in India’s biggest daily highlights the issue. 

We have created a fun video which explains everything that we believe in. You can watch how a poor athlete, despite being highly talented, struggles to make his dream come true. 



How do we support Athletes?

There are multiple ways in which we are trying to make an impact. These are in the following domains:

1.  Funding – We provide a crowdfunding platform to the athletes which can help them raise funds to sponsor their preparation. With the raised funds, they get access to better facilities, equipment, technology, nutritionists, doctors, trainers, etc. You can view some of the athlete campaigns on our platform here.

2.  Visibility – Athletes in India never enjoy the visibility they deserve. We have decided to change that. We are giving extensive media coverage to many deserving athletes. As a result, they are now being approached by various Magazines, Blogs and other forms of media as well.

3.  Conducting Mental Conditioning and Psychology sessions – During a big event, it’s all about how an athlete can handle the pressure and stay calm to produce their best performance. ‘India For Sports’ has tied up with companies which specialize in conducting mental conditioning sessions, diet consultancy sessions and performance enhancement sessions for athletes. The impact of this was visible when one of our athletes won the bronze medal at the Incheon Asian Games 2014.

4.  'Sportify India' – We believe in thinking for the long term. The only way to do that is to create a self sustaining engine for sports, which can only happen if we decide to change the mindset of the people. We strive to do this on a regular basis through our social media posts. Our Facebook and Twitter pages are garnering widespread popularity.


Why should you support this Project?

From zero support to currently more than 4200 people behind us, we have come a long way in such a short span of time. We don’t take any revenue cuts from the money we raise for our athletes as we believe that every penny is important to make a difference in the lives of probably the most deserving athletes in India. That is why we look for alternate ways of running our platform.

We have the stories of these athletes on our website. They are facing problems ranging from lack of basic spikes to lack of good coaches and equipment. There is an athlete whose family had to sell their family shop and land so that their talented son could pursue shot put. Another athlete’s mother had no option but to pawn her gold ornaments and sell the family car to buy her archer son a modern bow. 

Through our small step, we are trying to create a positive feedback loop, the effect of which will be huge in time to come.

Watch one of our athletes Amit Kumar Dahiya, known among his friends as ‘Rocky Balboa’ for his attitude and strength, in his campaign video here.


Why should you contribute to the athletes from a different country if you are not an Indian?

This might be the first question that would cross my mind after reading this if I weren't an Indian. 

Fair enough.

We at IFS believe that talented athletes, irrespective of the country they belong to, should be given a fair chance to represent their country at international sports events. There are many talented athletes who struggle to even get to these events, mostly due to due to lack of proper sports gear, lack of training and infrastructure and lack of funds to arrange a ticket for international travel. Don’t you think if an athlete is talented and has to potential to alter a world record, he/she deserves a chance?

And even after knowing that some of these athletes would probably be competing against athletes from your country and still contributing for their cause to give them an equal chance of a competition is something that only a true champion can do. And more than being a champion you showcase that there are no limits to humanity as looking beyond borders is what humanity teaches us most. We cannot thank you enough for creating such a big impact in somebody’s life.


Why do we not ask for funds directly for the athlete, instead of a platform which in turn raises funds for them?

“Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime”

Since a one-time support will only help a few athletes and will not solve the deep rooted problem permanently, we wish to think ‘Big’ and have already created a crowdfunding platform where we identify poor athletes who have huge potential of garnering great success. If our platform gets sufficient funds, it will do wonders for hundreds of athletes.


How will the funds be utilized?

We intend to raise an amount of $12,000 through Indiegogo.com, which is 40% of the total amount we need for our fixed costs and to operate for at least a year - $30.000. We have bootstrapped and have already put in the first 30% of the amount, $9,000 so that we could launch the platform. We would be raising the rest of the amount through other means.

Now that we are getting some good support for our athletes after our launch, we plan to scale big and reach out to as many athletes as possible for which we need your support.

A huge portion of the raised money will go towards the website development, deployment, onsite presence, offsite promotions, etc. The funds being raised will be utilized for the first year. A break-up of these costs is given below:

Offsite promotions – $5,000

Web promotions – $3,000

Athlete On-boarding – $1,000

Website maintenance – $1,000

Website content development – $2,000

Total target through Indiegogo – $12,000

Photo: Sandeep Yadav, a young wrestler who was very excited when we interviewed him.


What if we are able to raise funds more than the specified amount?

We have trust that people across the globe will identify with our initiative and will contribute with all their heart. In such an overwhelming situation, we will allocate the amount raised to further our cause as the target amount is only 40% of what we need for the first year of operating costs.


What if we fail to raise the set amount?

Even if we fail to raise the target amount, we will not be bogged down but will look for alternate ways of raising money. So, however small be the amount, we will gladly accept the kind gesture with humble gratefulness.


Why do people love us?

We have received huge appreciation and love for our efforts already. Some have pledged monetary support for our deserving athletes while there have been many who have wrote to us that they want to support us by being a part of our team. Imagine the inspiration and drive that we get when we receive these e-mails!

Arohi Deshpande from Mumbai wrote to us, “I have been a practitioner of Badminton and Running since the age of 13 and have worked closely with some poor but highly talented athletes. Hence, understanding of the grave issue, passion for sports and the dream of clinching medals at the highest level is what brings me to ‘India For Sports.’”

Arohi now works with IFS as a Sports Evangelist and doesn't draw a paycheck. In fact, none of us do! This initiative is the result of our passion for sports and desire to bring true change.


Keeping you informed.

We know that for a contributor the most important aspect for their contribution is the impact it creates in the society. 

We will keep you updated with not only how we are creating an impact by the funds contributed by you, but also how, these contributions are making a difference in the lives of poor athletes in India. 


Other ways you can help.

There are multiple ways you can be a part of this initiative. Please tell your friends and family if you think what we are doing is worth sharing with them.

We understand that not everyone can make an help monetarily. But there are other ways of creating the same impact. Studies show that 'People listen to People' and if you spread the word out through social media; Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin and word of Mouth, we would be indebted forever. We will be happy to reciprocate by endorsing your brand or corporation during our journey through the social media sites. 

We greatly appreciate your support and contributions. We literally could not do this without your help. 

We would love to receive any form of communication from you. Please write to us at info@indiaforsports.com or give us a call at +91-8971933411. 

In the comments section, please share with us your thoughts on India For Sports. We always love words of appreciation and take constructive feedback with an attitude of improving the platform.
