All of the links are at the top of the page, just as simple as a click.  Be the change and donate, just click the "Back It" button and enter the amount. STEP 1:  Find the "Back it" Button at the top of the page. STEP 2:  Choose your Donation Amount, and press Continue.Handmade by peruvian artisans bracelet Le Qara T-shirt  Le Qara Tote bag  STEP 3:  Fill the form with your payment details. Any help will bring us closer to a better planet for all of us!Help us change the planet! #LetsChangeClothes, this year we are making our pilot production plant, with your help we would be able to reach the worldwide market, make different textures and colors for our bioleather. And more importantly any help would bring us closer to a pollution-free planet and a clothing industry slaughter-free.Make this journey with us!                 VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOLEl cuero se lleva la vida de millones de animales cada año. La producción también es perjudicial para el medio ambiente. Libera toxinas, utiliza metales pesados ​​y desperdicia agua. Existen alternativas veganas, pero pocas han igualado las propiedades únicas que hacen que el cuero sea tan especial.Hasta ahora.Este textil innovador proviene de exóticas flores y frutas peruanas. Imita diversas texturas de piel, colores y niveles de dureza y grosor. Cultivado y desarrollado a partir de microorganismos en un laboratorio de biotecnología, el material se produce en los mismos tamaños estándar de la industria que el cuero convencional. Cambiar a esta alternativa vegana es una transición suave para los diseñadores, fabricantes y cualquier otra persona detrás de la escena. Además, como el material es 100% biodegradable, los restos del proceso se pueden usar como compost líquido.Lab Leather es una solución de desperdicio cero que ahorra recursos valiosos y protege a nuestros animales. Todo el lujo, sin la culpa. ¿Qué podría ser mejor que eso?¿Has pensado en cómo proteger a los animales, nuestra agua, aire y suelo?¿Quieres ser el cambio?El cambio comienza contigo, solo pasando la voz. Todos los enlaces están en la parte superior de la página, tan simple como un clic. Sé el cambio y dona, solo haz clic en el botón "Back it" e ingresa la cantidad. PASO 1:   Encuentra el botón "Back it" en la parte superior de la página.PASO 2:  Elije la cantidad de donación y presiona Continuar. Handmade by peruvian artisans bracelet Le Qara T-shirt  Le Qara Tote bag  PASO 3:  Rellena el formulario con tus datos de pago. ¡Cualquier ayuda nos acercará a un planeta mejor para todos nosotros!¡Ayúdanos a cambiar el planeta! #LetsChangeClothes, este año haremos nuestra planta piloto de producción, con su ayuda podremos llegar al mercado mundial, hacer diferentes texturas y colores para nuestro biocuero. Y, lo que es más importante, cualquier ayuda nos acercará más a un planeta libre de contaminación y una industria de moda sin sacrificio.¡Haz este viaje con nosotros!

story:
Download for Desktop free

SNOW WHITE BIG BLUE 

 

I

BLACK CHROME CLASSIC

This is not my first Project. Since last project I have an order from the company STRELA get a new construction and so after my first idea originated this project.

BLUE SUN RAY  

They write about us ... "I have a feeling this particular Kickstarter project is going to go like rocket fuel." 

 In contrast to many other reissues on the market, this model has been completely redesigned and reconstructed  with modern appointments.  The style of this watch fits well into the daily life, you can wear the watch not only with the jacket suit, but also with the sport. Here you have the possibility to get a STRELA with Japanese movement VK64a, which has been modified by Time Modul Instruments.

ABlogtoWatch write: "...this results in an unmistakably '60s look that fans of the original can appreciate"

We chose the Indiegogo and Kickstarter because the interaction with the supporters is the best. Here one learns from each other in favor of all the participants. Suggest new additions to the project and open a new stretch goals.

CASE BACK - screwed & laser engraved

 

Product description

 The masses and the weight of the watch are so optimized that it is an advantage for men and women! Some details, e.g. the Telemeter Scala, I have equipped with light-sign print at position 12H to remind one not a professional that the telemeter scale works with the help of light and the noise. The Luma points are decent, so not like in many sports watches. This points replace the indices at positions 3H and 9H. The inner seconds and tachymeter scales are combined. The water resistance is maximized to 5 ATM, which is not standard in similar designs. The screwed case back is equipped with a laser engraving. 

The space capsule "VOSKHOD 2" is inscribed in Cyrillic: "Voskhod 2 - The first cosmonaut squad of the USSR - P. Beljaev A.Leonov - 1965 Russia STRELA". The Strap is made of genuine leather and the buckle is also laser engraved too.

BLUE SUN RAY

 

Live 1 on wrist 

BUCKLE - mirror polished & laser engraved

 

 

 

STORY

March 18, 1965 – the space exploration milestone Alexey Arkhipovich Leonov became the first human to walk in space. He was outside the space craft for 12 minutes and 9 seconds, connected to the craft only by a 5.35 meter tether. He achieved something no human ever achieved before. A milestone in space exploration never forgotten. A.Leonov was wearing STRELA’s during mission preparation, flight training and missions.

The first Russian STRELA chronographs were produced by the Moscow watch factory. The production machines were bought from Switzerland and the first Strela chronographs with mechanical movement 3017 were produced with it. This caliber was based on a Swiss caliber Venus 150. These movements are no longer produced today.

 

Delivery & Chipping

Chipping start is MARCH 2018

Wristwatch WARRANTY  2  YEARS! 

I have planned 1 month buffer for delivery time, It is possible to get your rewards more earlier.

Service over univaque w.co or directly by strela 

 

HOMAGE on

As a source of inspiration, i turned to the original Strela and Sekonda models. Here is a Sample of a old original  Sekonda. 

HOMEPAGE PROJECT SITE AND CONTACTS ( Impressum )

www.univaque-watches.com

GERMANY MUNICH

story:
The Warmest Scarf in the World - SUSTAIN SPORT HEATED SCARF
In cold winter days, a nice scarf is what most people would instantly reach for to keep one’s neck area warm. But before your neck starts to feel warm, it’ll take a little time before your body temperature warms up the scarf. So we thought, wouldn’t it be even better if this scarf could generate warmth on its own?


Active Portable Warmth

Instead of putting on layers of clothes “ just “ to keep your body temperature at best, there is a better way. SUSTAIN Sport Heated scarf generates heat higher than your body temperature to fight off coldness, proactively provides the heat your body needs to feel warm right when you need it!

SUSTAIN SPORT Heated scarf is a soft and lightweight scarf with an ultra-efficient graphene fiber heating core providing almost instant warmth. With the use of silver nano processed anti-bacterial fabrics, quick drying and breathable properties keep your neck comfortable at all times.

Quickly absorbs moisture to keep you dry under the scarf.

Quick adaption to climate changes

Drastic climate change affects all us all. The temperature can drop 29 Fahrenheit (15 degrees) from the mid-day to the evening. We know you want a hassle-free garment.

Graphene carbon fiber heating core, providing heat in 15 secs.

2 constant heat settings, 107 ℉/114℉ (42℃/46℃), can be easily toggled to fit your needs.

Silver nano processed fabrics

Silver nano is an effective agent in defending against bacteria. Since scarves are worn close to the mouth and nose area, it’s crucial to make this scarf anti-bacterial and allergen-free. ( Official test report included in the specs section )

Silver nano embedded particles protect against invading bacteria as soon as they are attached to the fabric.

  • Ultra slim and soft  
  • Highly efficient and stable 
  • Waterproof and durable 

Graphene carbon fiber heating core

Thanks to the ultra-efficient graphene carbon fiber heating system embedded in the SUSTAIN Sport Heated scarf, one full charge will keep your neck warm for more than 3 hours.

Up to 3.5 hrs of use on one charge. ( Could vary under different ambient temperature conditions ).

If you wish to use your own or a larger capacity power bank, you can make use of the USB extension cable included and leave the power bank in your pocket.

Easy to wear system - So quick and easy to wear 

Never get tangled up in long scarves again! Long scarves are often very bulky around the neck and can take a while to wrap on and unwrap. SUSTAIN heated scarf's easy to wear system enables you to put it on and take it off within seconds. Magnets stitched within the scarf, no more bulky wrapping around. These 2 ways of wearing lets you quickly adapt to the environment, so if you frequently move in-between indoors and outdoors, just simply change between the 2 ways.

Far infrared emission

SUSTAIN SPORT heated scarf uses a special fabric that induces far-infrared (FIR) emission when heated. The merits of FIR is that the warmth penetrates deeper under the skin and it creates a microclimate in between the neck and the scarf, making the heated scarf comfortable to wear without feeling dryness during wearing.

After a long day at work spending a long time looking down on our smartphone and laptop, it is time to give your neck a good rest. Put on our comfortable warming scarf, sit back & relax the tense neck muscles. It is like the comfort of a hot towel on your neck, but it doesn’t get cold.

 

Minimal, low keyed designed, it is so easy to match with your outfit.

SUSTAIN SPORT Heated Scarf comes in Steel grey, Navy and Red.

 Premium packaging makes a perfect gift for every occasion.

Simply put in the power bank and press the button to start heating. 

 

 

 

 

Started in 2013, HOMI CREATIONS was established for the causes of a seamless lifestyle we envision.

The SUSTAIN collection was established to create advanced clothing, we have chosen a scarf to be our first product, because we know how people depend on it for extra warmth and how it could be carried with easily. Utilizing advanced technology, we blend in between different industries, we add in fashion elements and design in the fabrics we use, relying on traditional stitching works to finish the final product. SUSTAIN SPORT is a perfect collaboration across technology, design, fashion, and craftsmanship. 

To redefine the present way we live and things we use with simpler, easier, cleaner, minimalistic products, creating a modern and seamless lifestyle is what we envision and set out to achieve.

 

1. How do I clean SUSTAIN SPORT?

We recommend to clean with a damp cloth and leave it dry before use again. You can also hand-wash if you wish, only to make sure the power bank has been taken out and the USB cap is on. Do not dry clean or tumble dry.

2. Will it overheat with time?

The 2 heat settings are constant and they do not get hotter with time, for some sensitive groups, we suggest you to stop using it as soon as you feel the temperature is too high. 60 mins auto-shut off makes sure the contacted area gets a rest from heating.

3. How long will the heating last on one charge?

With our designated power bank ( 4000 mah ), it could last in between 3 - 3.5 hrs depending on the given temperature conditions.

You can also use the USB extension cable included to use your own power bank that might have a larger capacity.

4. How heavy is the scarf with the power bank?

The total weight is 205g, this is lighter than most of the thicker scarves. During our test trial we have 50 female across all ages to try the scarf, only 1 had shown concerns about the weight while others do not feel any difference in comparison with their own regular scarves.

5. Can I use my own power banks?

Yes, only our power bank is designed to put in to the hidden pocket in the scarf, if your power bank does not fit into the pocket, you can make use if the USB extension cable included.

With our own power bank, you will be able to operate the button on the scarf without switching on the power bank. For other power banks, you might have to switch on the power bank before pressing the button on the scarf.

story:
Pharos Watches is proud to announce the Sentinel Collection consisting of two models: the full lume Sentinel and sunburst Sentinel B. Through both of our models we aimed to create a truly unique watch with many distinctive aspects. The result was a watch crafted in avant-garde fashion, creating a timepiece we hope is unlike anything else in the marketplace. 

The uniqueness of the Sentinel and Sentinel B is evident in the crown (which is lumed), lug curvature, and steel case finished with a variety of polished grooves and brushed notches. The defining feature of the Sentinel Collection is the usage of Swiss SuperLuminova in the dial and crown of each watch.

We designed both the full lume Sentinel and sunburst Sentinel B to provide two unique options for multiple tastes. The full lume Sentinel is more eclectic, whereas the Sentinel B is a more traditionally-inspired dive watch. Nevertheless, both models include our signature lume, case design, and fully automatic Swiss movement. 

A Blog to Watch | WatchTime | The Time Bum | KeepTheTime.com

Check us out at www.pharoswatches.com | Download Our Press Pack

The Sentinel has a sandwich dial with a full lume display. Apart from the dial, all other specifications are identical to the Sentinel B. 

With quality components, detailed craftsmanship, and a unique design, our goal is to provide a high-quality, Swiss automatic watch at an affordable price.

While many other watches in the $400 - $900 price range use Japanese movements, Pharos has decided to utilize a fully automatic Swiss movement. Swiss movements are considered the best in the world, and are used by all luxury brands. As such, Pharos aims to deliver a top caliber watch without costing thousands of dollars. The Sentinel B has a sunburst dial with a partial lume ring display. Apart from the dial, all other specifications are identical to the Sentinel.

Each Pharos Sentinel and Sentinel B is powered by a Swiss Sellita SW200, automatic movement, complete with 26 jewels. 

Watch collectors will recognize that automatic movements are far superior to quartz movements. An automatic movement uses energy from the motion of a wearer’s wrist, whereas a quartz movement is powered by a battery. Like all battery operated machines, a quartz watch will need a new battery every couple of years. Watches with automatic movements, like the Sentinel, will continue to run indefinitely (with winding and setting the watch again after long periods without wearing it). 

Swiss automatic watch movements are considered the most robust and efficient movements in the world. Many Swiss movements have longer power reserve than their Japanese counterparts, require less winding, and are considered more reliable. 

(Sellita SW200 Automatic Movement in our PVD Sentinel. Photo Courtesy of KeepTheTime.com)

All Sentinel models use the highest quality Swiss SuperLuminova in their dials, hands and crowns. This ensures an extremely bright and long-lasting luminescence.

Every full lume Sentinel backer will get to decide what color hands they want on their watch (blue or green). This allows you to have consistent lume colors or contrasting lume colors (for legibility).

The Sentinel and Sentinel B each have an engraved case back showing the Pharos of Alexandria.

 

(Accurate representation of how the Pharos of Alexandria is believed to have looked)

You asked for it and we’ve heard you! We’ve contacted our suppliers and confirmed that we can make this available to ALL of our backers at NO additional charge. That’s right - you will be able to choose your hand lume color for your Sentinel (either matching or contrasting lume). Please look at the photos below to see some examples!

Every Sentinel will come with a leather AND rubber strap with quick release functionality. You will get the chance to choose the colors you want when selecting your perk.  

Tan & Brown Quick Release Leather Straps with Engraved Logo on Buckle

Blue & Black Quick Release Leather Straps with Engraved Logo on Buckle​

Black & Blue Quick Release Rubber Straps with Engraved Logo on Buckle

All leather and rubber straps contain a quick release function, making it seamless to change straps.

Every Sentinel comes packaged in a sturdy and high quality grey lacquer display box. This box stores your extra straps and certificate underneath the removable watch tray.

Our brand gets its name and inspiration from the Lighthouse of Alexandria, also known as the Pharos of Alexandria. This ancient lighthouse was built in Egypt around 280-247 BC and is considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. The Pharos of Alexandria served as a prototype for all other lighthouses in the world

From: The Story of Lighthouses, Lightships and Lifeboats, by Olwen Reed, published in 1968

Inspired by the Pharos of Alexandria, our logo depicts four beams of light emanating downward from a central lighthouse. Additionally, the abundant lume in both the Sentinel and Sentinel B emits a glow reminiscent of the light that shines from a lighthouse. An accurate depiction of the Lighthouse of Alexandria is also engraved on each case back.

In addition to the lacquer display box discussed above, every Sentinel will come with a leather AND rubber strap. You will get the chance to choose the colors you want when selecting your perk. 

You will also get to choose what color lume you want the hands of your watch to be. This will depend on whether you want a consistent lume color across the whole watch, or whether you want your hands to have a different lume color for contrast and legibility. You will also decide on this when selecting your perk.

For an additional $40, you can upgrade to a fitted metal bracelet (you will receive the metal bracelet in addition to the leather and rubber strap already included with your Sentinel). Since we have not yet completed the production of the bracelets, the rendering below provides an accurate representation. To order a metal bracelet, please select the perk the indicates the metal bracelet option.

Additionally, all our watches come with a two year warranty. This covers any structural or mechanical issues. If you have any issues, you just send your watch back to our United States based service center!

All orders placed in the United States will not incur any shipping fees. Any international orders incur an additional $25 shipping charge. 

  • Campaign Guidance Provided by Early Bird Studios: https://www.earlybirdstudios.com

Additionally, the abundant lume in both the Sentinel and Sentinel B emits a glow reminiscent of the light that shines from a lighthouse. An accurate depiction of the Lighthouse of Alexandria is also engraved on each case back.In addition to the lacquer display box discussed above, every Sentinel will come with a leather AND rubber strap. You will get the chance to choose the colors you want when selecting your perk. You will also get to choose what color lume you want the hands of your watch to be. This will depend on whether you want a consistent lume color across the whole watch, or whether you want your hands to have a different lume color for contrast and legibility. You will also decide on this when selecting your perk.For an additional $40, you can upgrade to a fitted metal bracelet (you will receive the metal bracelet in addition to the leather and rubber strap already included with your Sentinel). Since we have not yet completed the production of the bracelets, the rendering below provides an accurate representation. To order a metal bracelet, please select the perk the indicates the metal bracelet option.Additionally, all our watches come with a two year warranty. This covers any structural or mechanical issues. If you have any issues, you just send your watch back to our United States based service center!All orders placed in the United States will not incur any shipping fees. Any international orders incur an additional $25 shipping charge. Campaign Guidance Provided by Early Bird Studios: https://www.earlybirdstudios.com

story:
Hello everyone. My name is Brian.I own a small clothing brand located on the west coast an hour north of San Francisco called Loud Pakz. Loud Pakz is the name of the business ( with the trademarking process under way.) The name Loud Pakz has a double meaning. It’s either pungent grade A quality marijuana that smells so loud that you can hear it, or to be loud not necessarily vocally, but with your lifestyle, and not to care or be affected by what other people think. Just be you. 

    Starting a business in today's competitive, ever changing market has been one of the most challenging things I have ever done but I love it so much and nothing will stop me from pursuing my goals. It’s a dream of mine to produce clothing with a low impact on the planet and a large impact on the fashionable consumers’ everyday life. In order to create the least environmental impact and a people/animal friendly company, my goal is to purchase the greenest possible USA made materials to keep our carbon footprint very low.      

    I'm here to raise funds in order to get my quality merchandise out to consumers that are bored and tired of the same old watered down repetitive clothing that inhabits the current market. Before designing clothing I studied culinary arts, which taught me at least 2 important things: to pay attention to details, and that creativity has no boundaries. Without my culinary training I never would have found my true passion for creating my own clothing line and being a small business owner. I have no doubt in my mind that this is what I am meant to do. It’s like when you stand on the ground and it feels solid, and that's how I feel about creating a clothing brand. Plus with every one thousand dollars raised ($1000) I'll donate seventy five dollars ($75) to Campus California   www.campus-california.org .

   By donating funds or your time, you'll help me pursue my goals. Over the next five years. I want to be filling orders of a hundred plus products/items, have at least four employees, do two to three trade shows/expos a year, be carried in at least twenty five different clothing stores/boutiques and smoke shops, have an online presence in major web based stores and a permanent flagship store location and much more.

    About a year ago I created my first clothing brand and learned the basics of the clothing industry. I had a good success rate by finding out what works as well as what doesn't and I applied that knowledge to my new brand LOUD PAKZ. I had 100% success rate in the hat (beanies and snapbacks) department by selling out all stock and being back ordered within the first two months while doing all the promotion/marketing, graphic design, finances, web design, etc. by myself. Below is photos of my previous works.

                
   

      I am looking to raise $7000 and if this goal is met $5000 would go into merchandise production, design, and development while the remaining $2000 would be for marketing and promotion (website, launch party, promotional items, local events, trade shows, and Indiegog fee's) as well as a $525 donation to Campus California www.campus-california.org . If the goal isn't met funds will be prorated and disbursed accordingly in the proper category that would benefit the brand most efficiently. 

    Click on the link to our Facebook page below to view promotional media. Thank you for your time. Sincerely,

Brian F.

LOUD PAKZ 

Owner/CEO

story: OTIUM - THE STORY
story_txt: OTIUM - THE STORY

story:
Apolis (a-pöl-is) means “global citizen.”

We are a socially motivated lifestyle brand that empowers communities worldwide (http://apol.is/about). 


Why Crowdfunding?

We believe crowdfunding is a responsible way to manage supply & demand, avoid waste and provide YOU with a price that is 50% less than the retail value.


Mexico and the Industry of Glass Manufacturing:

Over the last 10 years 75% of all glass blowing studios in Mexico have closed due to global competition. We need YOUR help to support one of the few remaining glass-blowing studios in Mexico by partnering with us and pre-ordering our new collection of Apolis glassware. 

The overwhelming local response from these glass blowing studios throughout Mexico was "Help us better showcase the process, the value, the one-of-a-kind design of each item. No one really quantifies the process, so making the same item robotically for a fraction of the price is better business, but often at the cost ­of the workers or the environment.”


How You Can Help:

Buying a piece from our glassware collection will help preserve a dying art form. 

We are introducing the first artisan + designer collaboration marketplace in partnership with Indiegogo. We need YOUR help to support one of the few remaining glass-blowing studios in Mexico by partnering with us and pre-ordering our new collection of Apolis glassware.

Through this business model we want to connect individuals from all walks of life who believe we desperately need to re-think the way we buy and sell.


What We Are Doing:

We spent the last year with Studio Xaquixe in Mexico observing & studying any way we could help preserve the art of glass blowing. Their innovative design inspired us to develop a new marketplace to deepen our commitment of empowering communities worldwide. And through that we designed an assortment of 100% recycled glassware, hand-blown by artisans in Oaxaca.


How It Will Work:

Because we only produce what is ordered, we can avoid thousands of pounds of waste and lost energy – which is a side effect of over producing. And by taking part in this business model,

Not only will your glassware be half the retail price, but you will have a hand in creating jobs and preserving the art of glass-blowing.


What We Believe:

We believe all people are created equal and should have equal access to the global marketplace.

Over the last 10 years of building our brand we have discovered a new opportunity for how we can buy and sell products to positively benefit everyone in the supply chain. But it starts with ALL of US — the people who choose what we buy and sell. And if you are anything like us we make our decisions based on design being the most important. So to make this simple we believe good design from the product design to the supply chain design can solve—not marginally sustain—human and environmental problems within our lifetime.


Transparency:


Press on this Initiative:

Fast Company: http://goo.gl/Dch4NM

Yahoo: https://goo.gl/08aCH1

Huffingtonpost: http://goo.gl/drfV9b

Council Fashion Designers America: http://goo.gl/3KgWfV

Wallpaper: http://goo.gl/CtcYCg


Timeline:




Perks:

story:
THE BELIEVER SPECIAL GOLD EDITION

 

Luminous fill on the indices and hands so you can view the time in any light.

 

 

Risks and challenges

We are lucky to have a strong and direct relationship with our manufacturer. This enables us to take full control over production and quality control. We understand that quality and delivery is key, we want to build trust with our backers and give them the quality they deserve.

Engineering the Believer presented some difficulties as we wanted the watch to express boldness and personality yet still comfortable for everyday wear. The Any Time logo motif surrounding the bezel is our signature design, achieved by using CNC machine cutting technique, giving the watch a more rugged and industrial look. We were certain about using 316L grade stainless steel, for it’s resistant to corrosion and salt-water (ocean-friendly) abilities. But this also adds weight to the watch, hence we went for the lighter Japan Miyota OS2A movement, while not reducing the quality and reliability.

We are a start-up company and don’t have the human and financial resources like big brands or large corporations, however, we are extremely passionate about what we do and we’ve given our 100% on this project. We’ve been working on this project for almost a year and were able to seek advice and worked alongside some of the most talented and passionate individuals. We want to take this opportunity say a Big Thank You to: Ah Fei, Rex, Michael, Sebastian, Stephanie, Andrew, Nigel, Ash, Lucille, David and Gilcy the dog. For the hard work and support you’ve given us, helped us and trusted us in times of difficulties, thank you all, it meant the world to us.

To all International Backers: We offer free shipping worldwide as an additional blessing. Please note that you might be responsible for duties, fees and taxes applicable in your country. 
For more information or to calculate your Duty/VAT/GST please visit this website: http://www.thevatcalculator.com/international-v...


We promise complete transparency and will communicate with our backers on a regular basis and provide updates on our production and delivery status on our Indiegogo home page and other social media platforms.

THANK YOU for backing us and taking part in this adventure with us!! 
Stay tuned to our social media for more exciting projects coming.

-ANY TIME

story:
"We have raise $30000+ from May to August 2016, thanks to your interest, we continue taking pre-orders for our bags, with expected shipping this Christmas."

 

WITH WOMEN IN MIND

The modern woman balances many roles - mother, daughter, wife, employee, friend, confidant, and various others. She is strong, she is important and she is valued. Her bag should also embody this strength, importance and value.

 

OUR VISION FOR YOU

  • A practical handbag you can use for the gym, work, travel, play, and everywhere in between. 
  • A timeless piece of fashion with classic design, but enough flexibility for you to show your individual style and uniqueness. 
  • Hundred years of craftsmanship packed in a versatile and functional handbag.

 

ONE BAG IN THE PLACE OF MANY

What makes Onnix unique is that the detachable front (clutch) of our bags can be used independently as a cross body clutch. This clutch is designed to fit all of the different Onnix tote bodies, giving you versatility to change the colour, size, and function of your bag with ease.

 

 

You don't feel the same every day, and we believe that your bag should not look the same every day either. Our interchangeable clutches give you the freedom to express yourself and match the bag with the best outfit to fit your day, your mood or style.

With two totes and six clutches, 18 different bag combinations can be formed. You can then build your own capsule closet and explore hundreds of outfit combinations using mobile apps such as Stuff N Style. 

 

 

FUNCTIONALITY

The Card Wallet

  • Two front card slots holding up to 4 cards 
  • One back card slot holding up to 2 cards 
  • Key ring 

The Onni Clutch 

  • Fits: Kindle, phone, keys, lipstick, passport, credit cards, wallet, other essentials.
  • Dimensions: 19 cm x 25 cm x 3.5 cm, 7.5" x 9.8" x 1.4"
  • Cross body strap length: Adjustable, maximum 120 cm, 48"
  • Organisation: One front and one back pocket.

 

The Rosa Tote (the 10 inch)

  • Fits: iPad or Tablet up to 10 inches, keys, notebook, shoes, phone, wallet, other essentials.
  • Dimensions: 25 cm x 34 cm x 12 cm, 9.8" x 13.4" x 4.7"
  • Handle drop: 10 cm, 4"
  • Cross body strap length: Adjustable, maximum 110 cm, 43"
  • Organisation: Two open pockets, one zip pocket, one key chain that also doubles as a clutch wristlet. 

The Elizabeth Tote (the 13 inch)

  • Fits: Laptop up to 13 inches, keys, notebook, shoes, water bottle, phone, wallet, Kindle, umbrella, other essentials.
  • Dimensions: 29 cm x 44 cm x 15 cm, 11.4" x 17.3" x 5.9"
  • Handle drop: 15 cm, 6"
  • Cross body strap length: Adjustable, maximum 104 cm, 41"
  • Organisation: Three open pockets, one padded laptop pocket, one zip pocket, one key chain that also doubles as a clutch wristlet.

 

YOUR PERKS

The below designs are to be improved according to backers' requests.

Onni Clutch 

LUXE Clutch with 4 colour options: Black, Tan, Grey, Orange

DELUXE Clutch with 2 colour options: Black and Leopard,  Florence and Brown.

Rosa Tote + Luxe Clutch

(Tote in tan and clutch in 4 colour options: Black, Tan, Grey, Orange)

 

Rosa Tote + Deluxe Clutch

(Tote in tan and clutch in 2 two-tone colour options: Black & Leopard, Brown & Florence)

 

Elizabeth Tote + Luxe Clutch

(Tote in black and clutch in 2 two-tone colour options: Black, Tan, Grey, Orange)

 

Elizabeth Tote + Deluxe Clutch

(Tote in black and clutch in 2 two-tone colour options: Black & Leopard, Brown & Florence)

 

QUALITY LEATHER & CRAFTSMANSHIP

We visited one of the biggest leather exhibitions in Europe to meet our leather and hardware suppliers in person. Our aim was to find a material that required minimal care, extremely long-lasting and was made ethically.

We settled on three different cross-hatched printed leather samples to test in our prototyping sessions (hence, the different colour totes and clutches that you see from our video.) We chose one leather sample from France, one from Italy, and one from Portugal.

We sent our prototypes through aggressive wrinkle, water, and scratch testing to see if the material would hold up. In the end, only group 3 passed all of our tests and emerged victorious - the leather from Italy! This Italian leather is the only leather on offer in our choice of colour swatches.

Eco-friendly tannery

In Premiere Vision Paris our designer met with more than 20 leather suppliers all around the world. Although many other suppliers are cheaper we only work with the top quality tanneries that have both REACH and ISO 14001:2004 Environmental Management System. 

This ensures that their waste water is well treated before being released into the environment and no harmful toxic/cancer causing chemicals are used in the tanning process. In the end, these bags will be used ourselves and by our family as well.

 

European Craftsmanship

Crafting Onnix Prototypes

 

TIMELINE

CREDITS, COLLABORATORS, AND CHAMPIONS

Our first round of thank you’s goes to our family, friends, and our #CreateYourOnni community for all your support! Thank you so much for backing our project, but more importantly, cheering us on throughout the process. Your thoughts, prayers, and kind words mean more than we could ever express. Your unconditional love and understanding has been humbling and leaves us striving to work even harder.

Credits (listed alphabetically) -

Thank you for your dedication, diligence, and expertise, without which we would have never pulled off our video, images, content, and campaign launch. Thank you!!

Amy - Model 
Belesha - Model 
David Newton - Videography & Photography 
Ethel - Coordinator & Instagram Wizard 
Felicia - Model & Twitter Magician 
Karen - Model & Blogger
Liezel - Model & Entrepreneur
Yana - Model 

Collaborators and champions (listed alphabetically) -

Thank you for your generosity! Despite your valuable and limited time, you shared your insights and experiences with us. This allowed us to propel Onnix Bags to where we are today. There is still so much learning and growth ahead for us, and we are very grateful for the foundation you have laid out. Thanks again!

Belinda (Mikimoto / Macy's / Tiffany & Co.), Caroline (Rag & Bone / Agent Provocateur), Chloe(Lulu Guiness / Hunter / Calvin Klein), Christine (ANN / Saks Fifth Avenue / Bloomingdale’s),Dan & Tim (Haerfest), Dessy (Utelier / Smythson), Erika (Tactile), Evelyn & Yehua (Pivotte),Gesche (Dreamers//Doers), Grace (DarcMatter / Tommy Hilfiger), Hanh (Stuff N Style), Ines(Debrett’s / CARRÉ MODE), Jessica (WellRoundedNY), Jono (M.Gemi), Joyce (Rockitt / Capulet London), Julie,  Jag (Sundar), Jamee (Rêve Public Relations), Kate (Magnifeco), Kevin (Uban Guerrilla), Natalie (the JIBS life / Sienna Ray), Ralph (photon fixer), Suzanne (Frugl), Tina (Tunalien), Wai Foong (Suit & Pie), Will (9999)

PRESS PACK

We hope that you find Onnix Bags useful. This startup journey has been very challenging and super exciting at the same time. We'd  love to share our story with you and your audience. Please check our Press Pack in this link and drop us an email directly to info@onnixbags.com for more information.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

We are confident in the abilities of our hard working team at Onnix London. We have spent many months doing our research on production, reward fulfilment, and quality control for our products. 

We formed relationships with those responsible for our raw materials and for producing our handbags. Our team in London have made detailed plans for manufacturing, packaging, and fulfilment. We have done our best to identify all the steps in the process, and to mitigate any unforeseen issues that may arise.

While we can guarantee our quality and our customer service, there is always a risk that suppliers can not fulfil orders on time due to unforeseen circumstances, which may delay shipping. We do guarantee and promise to communicate throughout this process with you in an open and honest manner and you would be informed straight away if there were any delays.

Please note, import duties & VAT may be applicable depending on your delivery destination. If you live outside the US or EU, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges.

In the end, these bags will be used ourselves and by our family as well. European CraftsmanshipCrafting Onnix Prototypes TIMELINECREDITS, COLLABORATORS, AND CHAMPIONSOur first round of thank you’s goes to our family, friends, and our #CreateYourOnni community for all your support! Thank you so much for backing our project, but more importantly, cheering us on throughout the process. Your thoughts, prayers, and kind words mean more than we could ever express. Your unconditional love and understanding has been humbling and leaves us striving to work even harder.Credits (listed alphabetically) -Thank you for your dedication, diligence, and expertise, without which we would have never pulled off our video, images, content, and campaign launch. Thank you!!Amy - Model Belesha - Model David Newton - Videography & Photography Ethel - Coordinator & Instagram Wizard Felicia - Model & Twitter Magician Karen - Model & BloggerLiezel - Model & EntrepreneurYana - Model Collaborators and champions (listed alphabetically) -Thank you for your generosity! Despite your valuable and limited time, you shared your insights and experiences with us. This allowed us to propel Onnix Bags to where we are today. There is still so much learning and growth ahead for us, and we are very grateful for the foundation you have laid out. Thanks again!Belinda (Mikimoto / Macy's / Tiffany & Co.), Caroline (Rag & Bone / Agent Provocateur), Chloe(Lulu Guiness / Hunter / Calvin Klein), Christine (ANN / Saks Fifth Avenue / Bloomingdale’s),Dan & Tim (Haerfest), Dessy (Utelier / Smythson), Erika (Tactile), Evelyn & Yehua (Pivotte),Gesche (Dreamers//Doers), Grace (DarcMatter / Tommy Hilfiger), Hanh (Stuff N Style), Ines(Debrett’s / CARRÉ MODE), Jessica (WellRoundedNY), Jono (M.Gemi), Joyce (Rockitt / Capulet London), Julie,  Jag (Sundar), Jamee (Rêve Public Relations), Kate (Magnifeco), Kevin (Uban Guerrilla), Natalie (the JIBS life / Sienna Ray), Ralph (photon fixer), Suzanne (Frugl), Tina (Tunalien), Wai Foong (Suit & Pie), Will (9999)PRESS PACKWe hope that you find Onnix Bags useful. This startup journey has been very challenging and super exciting at the same time. We'd  love to share our story with you and your audience. Please check our Press Pack in this link and drop us an email directly to info@onnixbags.com for more information. RISKS & CHALLENGESWe are confident in the abilities of our hard working team at Onnix London. We have spent many months doing our research on production, reward fulfilment, and quality control for our products. We formed relationships with those responsible for our raw materials and for producing our handbags. Our team in London have made detailed plans for manufacturing, packaging, and fulfilment. We have done our best to identify all the steps in the process, and to mitigate any unforeseen issues that may arise.While we can guarantee our quality and our customer service, there is always a risk that suppliers can not fulfil orders on time due to unforeseen circumstances, which may delay shipping. We do guarantee and promise to communicate throughout this process with you in an open and honest manner and you would be informed straight away if there were any delays.Please note, import duties & VAT may be applicable depending on your delivery destination. If you live outside the US or EU, you will be responsible for any applicable duty/VAT charges.

story:
High Spirits Clothing was developed by Hannah Sharp and Justin Hosey in 2012. We found that affordable active wear was scarcely offered by retailers. How can one motivate themselves to work out if they can't even afford the clothing to do so?? Enter Hannah's sewing machine and some spandex fabric... Two years and hundreds of experimental products and fabrics later, here we are!! 

High Spirits is not only clothing; we want it to be synonymous with happy and healthy living. When people see our logo, we don't want them to only think about yoga pants. High Spirits encompasses an entire way of living with positivity, passion, and pleasure. We would like to be able to help people. We want to share our advice and experiences with a purpose. We hope that the lessons that we have learned, big and small, can get someone else through a tough time, or inspire them to be the best person they can possibly be! 

Our goal is not to get rich off of our customers. We aim to please, with quality product at consistently affordable prices. Someday, we hope to have enough to be able to donate some of our proceeds to our favorite charities! All donations made to this page will be invested in new fabrics, screen-printing supplies, dyes, and the rest of the equipment we need to run our company!

A little about us... 

Justin is a certified personal trainer and studied nutrition, our personal construction specialist, and has experience with graphic design. His goal is to be able to donate proceeds to Ruffles Rescue, a dog rescue located in California. Having rescued a pit bull abandoned at a very young age who has extreme anxiety and attachment issues, we understand the need for organizations like Ruffles to keep running. This is only made possible by donations from fellow animal lovers!

Hannah trains friends and family and teaches a weekly exercise class for individuals with developmental disabilities, has studied nutrition and specializes in vitamins and all natural herbal supplements. She would like proceeds to be donated to Autism Awareness. Growing up with a sister with Autism has shaped the person that Hannah is today. It is her hope that the spread of awareness by this organization will help others come to grasp an understanding of the spectrum and what it entails in an individual's life, as well as the lives around them. 


Both Hannah and Justin have been training 6 days a week for a Spartan Sprint in July as well! We are happy to be here promoting positive lifestyles, self and mutual respect, and gratitude and appreciation.

We want to inspire you to be the best possible you that you can be!

story:
The Margherita lamp is a modern home accessory made from reused materials and characterized by a truly end-to-end environmentally conscious production process.

Every day in Turin, Italy, nearly 15,000 tomato sauce cans are used and thrown away by restaurants. We here at Izmade saw this as an opportunity to build a beautiful, impactful object while simultaneously sharing our philosophy of sustainability with the world.

So, how do we make this recycled lamp?

The Lampshade

We collect recycled tomato cans from local restaurants in Turin. The recovered cans are then washed, cut, and painted to create the lampshade. 

The Stand and the plywood

The plywood stand comes from beech trees, a species native to the Piedmont region. The layers of plywood are bonded by a renewable soybean adhesive, but the lamp itself is held together without any glue. It takes advantage of the friction between the stand and the connecting parts to hold its shape. 

We'll cook pizza with the scraps

Cutting the Wood

The wood is cut with a CNC milling machine that was built by Izmade in collaboration with Paolo Giacobbe and Paolo Di Napoli. Named the "Woody Router", it was built for an open-source project [see also Solidis] that allows citizens free use of the machine inside our Officine Creative workshop.

Electrical Components

All electrical components (including the cables, the plug, and the switch) come from Italy.


Our Workshop

Our production is hosted by Officine Creative, a community workshop project which promotes the artisan culture and enables shared creation. Officine Creative is part of Cecchi Point, a multicultural hub located in the heart of Turin.


Margherita in your environment

Its simple, friendly design is perfect for any setting: in the home, in your office, or for a young child's space. 

8 different colors

Margherita is available in 8 different colors, so that you can match the space you already have or bring in a fun pop of color!


Perks: What You'll Get

Campaign contributors have the chance to receive the Margherita lamp, as well as any of the below items. 


Margherita's heart

From the bottom of our hearts (and Margherita's), we'd like to thank our 10€ campaign contributors with a limited edition keychain. Hand-cut by our studio's "Woody Router", the keychain holds the centerpiece of the Margherita lamp by a strong, thin rope in the color of your choice. Available in all the same colors as the Margherita lamp.


Margherita's combo

Two Margheritas are better than one! Our 140€ campaign contributors will receive a set of two Margherita lamps in the colors of your choice.  Perfect for a set of bedside tables, or to spread the beauty of sustainability throughout your home.

Only 20 sets are available for this special price: 107€. Get yours before time runs out!


Meet Margherita's Mother, Dorothy

Before Margherita there was Dorothy, our sustainable desk lamp inspired by the Wizard of Oz's Tin Man. For the lampshade, scrap tin: like his strong yet humble body. For the base, wood: like the trees cut down by his axe. And a warm, shining lightbulb as a heart.  

Our  190€ campaign contributors will receive one of the Dorothy and Margherita lamps in the colors of their choice. 


Margherita & Umberto: A Match Made in Heaven!

Who better to accompany the Margherita lamp than Umberto, our beautiful and sustainable bedside table?

Umberto was born from two fruit crates scavenged from a local street market, disassembled and reassembled into a new shape without losing the original aesthetics. We added two iron slabs bent and welded together to form the legs... And presto! A common object was transformed into a dynamic bedside table.

This couple is available to our 200€ contributors, with the Margherita lamp in the color of their choice. 

Why support us?

We are a team of designers, architects, and marketers representing Izmade, a sustainable design studio from Turin, Italy. 

We are passionate about our work, and hope to share the beauty of sustainability with the world. By supporting our campaign, you will help us with the initial production costs required to get Izmade off the ground.

Reaching our goal will enable us to meet minimum order quantities and continue our commitment to environmentally conscious practices.

The Impact

An estimated 15,000 pizza sauce cans are thrown away every day in Turin alone. We at Izmade saw this as an opportunity to make an impact in our community and inspire environmentally-conscious, beautiful design worldwide. 

And we didn't just stop with the Margherita lamp. We have created a full range of sustainable home products and are crafting new ideas every day. From beginning to end, our design process is characterized by constant research on materials, with specific attention to reusable materials, industrial waste and byproducts, and innovative, certified materials. We strive to enhance the original characteristics of the materials in a new, beautiful, and functional object that you can be proud to own. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to learn more about Izmade, or see our full range of sustainable home products, go ahead and visit our website at http://www.izmade.com/

From our family here at Izmade, we thank you for supporting our cause.

Grazie!

A special thanks to:

Izmade For its passion and commitment
Paolo Di Napoli The Woody CNC master
Valentino Gesmundo For his design and tolerance of Izmade
Carlo Mossetti A young and super professional video maker [see TwinPixel]
Kaitlyn Henry For her warm voice and English support
Rosalba Tortia and Valentina Melotti For their passionate interpretations
Sarah, Alberto, Gaia and Leone For letting us use their cozy apartment
Giulia and Elena For being patient with their sweet and crazy other half
Viola Gesmundo For putting up Carlo and her cameo
Toro Compensati The company who gave us the wood sample
Officine Creative For its messy and friendly space
Cecchi Point A home for every citizen
Tarantino The oldest Cecchi-boy

thanks also to:

Farwaste For Turin tomato cans statistics
Giorgio Olivero For the tip regarding the surprise ending

story:
Short Summary

Mandeep Yadav is from Chandigarh, India, and has been training in the sport since the age of ten. You can read more about him at www.rallyingforlife.com
Mandeep has shown tremendous dedication and passion for the sport. While he has sacrificed a lot of time away from family, his family has sacrificed money, time away from their son, and their own dreams for their son in order to support him in this endeavor. 
 
I am the founder of Rallying for Life, where we strive to empower life/faith skills through the sport of tennis and eventually through other sports. 
 
One of the ways Rallying for Life has had the opportunity to do this is through the partnership of Mandeep's Coach, Ryan Fitzwilliam. They have an amazing partnership that goes beyond the tennis court. This partnership is more about developing a stronger partnership with the God that gave His life to each of us!

What We Need & What You Get

While the atheletes have concentrated on training and developing their passion to career status, it takes money. In order to allow Mandeep to continue focusing on training, our goal is to surround him with others who will focus on raising funds. 
 
Global Bridges, Inc. is a 501c3 organization. This means that your donation is tax deductible. 
 
 
Eighty percent of all proceeds will go to Mandeep's training prior to tournament play, tournament fees, travel expenses, clothing apparel, and administrative costs.
 
The remaining twenty (20) percent of all proceeds will go to Asha Deep School in Varanasi. Asha Deep is a K-8 school for the children of illiterate parents.  The school is in Varanasi and mostly works with children in the Nagwa and Samne Ghat slums. You can learn more at:  http://www.asha-deep.com/
 
In addition to knowing that your donation dollars will be assisting impoverished Indian children, each person who donates will also receive a personalized thank you note from Mandeep. 

The Impact

When I met this young man Mandeep, I was impressed with not only his tennis skills but his humble character and his passion to walk closer with God. Anyone who takes a moment with this young man will walk away not only refreshed but amazed by the courage he has to make it this far.
 
By helping him succeed, you will also help many children in impoverished parts of India get a chance to build healthier lives. Mandeep has a goal of eventually working along side Rallying For Life in India to provide children and adults in the slum areas of India to have opportunity to learn the sport, to enhance life skills and create a village of hope!

Other Ways You Can Help

While not everyone is able to contribute financially, you can still help the campaign by spreading the word on twitter, facebook, emails etc. We truly appreciate any support!

story:
My name is Jeff Niemiec and I am the Athletic Director at Eric Solorio Academy High School located on the southwest side of Chicago.  We are constantly trying to improve our facilities in order to give our student-athletes the tools necessary to compete at a high level. With 96.5% of our students considered low-income, fundraising within our community and families for major facility upgrades is challenging.  


One addition that we are hoping to fundraise for is an outdoor batting cage for our baseball and softball programs.  Currently we do not have a place where our student-athletes can go to hit live pitching.  For those of you who have played either sport, you know that hitting off a tee or doing soft toss is good practice, but cannot simulate seeing live batting practice.  This outdoor batting cage allows them the opportunity to put in that extra work before, during, and after practice throughout the year.


Our softball and baseball programs are run by two of the most dedicated and passionate coaches I have had the pleasure of working with: Daniel Gaichas and Roger Manzano. Both of their programs are coming off of conference championships and CPS playoff berths. They're ambassadors for their sport not just at Solorio, but within the Gage Park community where they run countless clinics and work with young children learning the game for the first time.  This gift to their programs would be welcomed and immediately put to good use. 

Any contribution you can make would be appreciated!

What your donation is purchasing:

Jugs Sports Frame for Batting Cage (70' x 14' x 12'): $1350
Jugs Sports Cage Netting and Hardware: $1415

Shipping Costs: $400

story:
My Story

I'm Marcel, known to many as Mickey, M. I. T. educated owner of a value engineering practice and Bronx born and bred creator of NYC Wear and Gear, a gifts and garments line that targets New Yorkers … and others with style and/or attitude.

Feel good interactions with fellow native New Yorkers I often encountered while traveling extensively on business stateside and abroad are what motivated me to introduce the line, which features items such kindred spirits and I could wear or use to celebrate our roots and showcase our shared civic pride.

However while achieving steadily increasing levels of appeal and acceptance in general, items that bear the trademarked logo of my Bona Fide New Yorker lifestyle brand, with the exception of caps, have received a lukewarm reception from folks who like for the designs on their garments to be significantly larger than sizes that can be cost-effectively embroidered or who favor design finishes with diverse looks and feels.

So this campaign is to raise funds sufficient for me to purchase two Hotronix heat presses and certain accessories.

The first, a 16” x 20” unit capable of placing large versions of my logo and other graphics on a variety of garments (T-shirts, tank tops, jerseys, jackets, hoodies, regular sweatshirts, sweatpants, etc.) and sundry promotional products, as well as Converse Chuck Taylor All Stars or other athletic footwear when outfitted with its special shoe platen and

the second, a cap-specific model to enable placement on headwear (caps, hats, headbands, ear warmers, visors, SoHoodies, etc.) full color digital transfer designs that are not large but feature finishes, fine details and/or gradients that simply cannot be done with embroidery.

Both presses produce results with the durability of quality screen printing and support the application of rhinestones and finishes with popular appearances (3D/Puff, prism-like, glitter/sparkle, sheen, frosted, metallic, mirror, safety/emergency:reflective and high-visibility neon, colors that glow in the dark or change when subjected to UV light, etc.) and/or the feel of a given material (suede, velvet, patent leather).

Your support of my campaign will enable me to invest in the two heat presses, do in-house embellishing of products that will enable me to fill small to medium size orders of customers who fall into the big & bold or diverse look & feel design camps and decorate test or show  garments with such designs which if they prove to be big sellers I will have done in large quantities by commercial screenprinting companies.

But that's not all. In addition to increasing the NYC Wear and Gear goods embellishment options, I will use the heat presses to place logos or other graphics on appropriate items for some of the small high tech firms and other businesses with which I am allied, as well as for friends who are photographers, graphic or performing artists, organizers of reunions, or members of school clubs or organizations, who not only lack the financial resources of large companies but often require quantities less than those at which screenprinting becomes economically attractive.

The relationships I've been cultivating and nurturing with custom screen printed transfer sheet specialists, who instead of printing directly onto products will print my logos and any other graphics I specify onto special release materials for transfer to items of interest whenever I choose using the proposed heat presses, and being able to operate the presses myself when necessary, will enable me to handle special requirements or last minute jobs of my friends/associates and at my discretion reduce or even completely eliminate labor charges to permit them to still proceed with projects even when their funds are especially tight.

Also I'll be positioned to produce creatively embellished pieces to sell and secure funds to supplement my personal donations to 501(c)(3) non profit organizations such as A Better Chance, AIDS Action Committee, Baruch College, Bronx Museum Of The Arts, Brooks School, City Squash, Harlem Children's Zone, Leukemia & Lymphoma Society, Massachusetts Institute Of Technology, Massachusetts Prostate Cancer Coalition, National Multiple Sclerosis Society and the Simpson Street Development Association that I have supported or others I might choose to support in the future.

And last but not least, I will be able to provide students attending local colleges with opportunities to make money working as part-time press operators or through their own entrepreneurial endeavors marketing and selling NYC Wear and Gear's heat press embellished items.

So please back my project and help make my proposed purchase of the two heat presses a reality by selecting a perk at the support/contribution level with which you are comfortable and then sharing word of this campaign with friends, relatives, associates and anyone else you believe will be inclined to do the same.

THANK YOU!

Your Perks

In exchange for your support and enabling me to raise the $3,000.00, all of which will be used to purchase the presses/associated equipment and cover campaign related fees,  you will receive the perks of your choice, be among the first to wear or use them and receive advance notice regarding NYC Wear and Gear's new products ... in particular any limited edition offerings.

Closely allied and collaborating with FIT alumni and technologists focused on fashion related innovation, look for NYC Wear and Gear to in the future introduce products that feature wearable electronics, exploit the special attributes of high tech materials or via the use of patented technology and a facilitating process provide custom tailored level, superb fit garments that require no tailor visits.

When a perk description indicates the design to be pressed is supporter selectable, you will be able to specify your choice from the following options.

Bona Fide New Yorker NYC Logo With The N and C Outlined

Bona Fide New Yorker NYC Logo With The N and C Solid

Take Five Jazz Quintet Graphic

Innovate Automate Penetrate Dominate Graphic

The perks are as follows.

$15 Support Perk Fanny Pack

$15 Support Perk Call Of The Wild Cellophane 2 Pack Spa Set

Note: My private labeled Call Of The Wild Collection body, hair and skin care products are manufactured by the company that was founded in 1993 when a family owned department store that had been at the heart  of retail activity in downtown Macon, GA  for more than 100 years suffered the fate of many such stores that lost their customers to suburban malls and closed its doors.

Customer demand for the store's very popular as well as most profitable body, hair and skin care products was so great the former company's President wisely exploited the opportunity, resumed manufacture of those products and over time successfully cultivated as customers all kinds of boutiques and spas to make the products available not only locally but nationwide.

A serendipitous encounter at a trade show led to him allowing me/Elements Of Style, LLC to like those companies private label his company's proven products.

$20 Support Perk Call Of The Wild Gift Bag

$20 Support Perk Knit Beanie

$20 Support Perk Acrylic Snapback Cap

$20 Support Perk Varsity/Spectator/Stadium Scarf  (available graphics-free)

$25 Support Perk Navy Blue Cotton Flexfit Precurved Bill Cap

$25 Support Perk Wool Blend Precurved Bill Snapback Cap

$25 Support Perk Wool Blend Precurved Bill Snapback Cap

$25 Support Perk Cotton/Polyester Fleece or Cotton/Polyester Terry SoHoodie

$25 Support Perk Call Of The Wild Travel Kit

$25 Support Perk Women's Dark Navy Crew Neck T

$25 Support Perk Men's Navy Crew Neck T-Shirt

$25 Support Perk Men's Black With White Trim Ringer T-Shirt

$30 Support Perk Men's Premium V-Neck T-Shirt

$30 Support Perk Women's ¾ Sleeves V-Neck T-Shirt

$35 Support Perk Special Limited Edition Wool Blend Snapback Cap

$50 Support Perk Sports/Hockey Style Hoodie

$50 Support Perk Conventional Black Hoodie

$100 Support Perk Black Converse Chuck Taylor All-Star Sneakers


Risks & Challenges

There is no question as far as feasibility because the heat press equipment in which I plan to invest is routinely being used by many companies to embellish goods exactly like those I am offering as perks.

Since March when I visited the Imprinted Sportswear Show (ISS is the largest trade show dedicated to the decorated apparel industry) in Atlantic City, where I saw live demos of the heat presses applying to various items of interest designs of different looks and feels, met with manufacturers/suppliers of garments, equipment  and materials, obtained answers to my questions regarding heat presses/accessories & heat transfers, and attended pertinent presentations, I have been communicating with representatives of the companies I met and attending application-specific webinars to ensure that should I encounter issues I lack the knowledge or skill to address I will know exactly who to consult or contract for solutions.

The presses, for which space has already been made available, will be shipping from a Pennsylvania-based sister company of their manufacturer and I have been assured they keep in stock large quantities of both models as well as any accessories I might choose to purchase.
I will be obtaining my transfer sheets from a second sister company that specializes in custom transfers.
The presses and the transfers typically ship the day after receipt of an order with 2nd day delivery.
The to be embellished blank perk items are stocked and deliverable, within a few days after order placement, directly from their respective manufacturers ... as well as many distributors.

The money required to acquire those items has been set aside and is available as needed to fund those purchases.
Since the limited edition caps are produced overseas with a lead time of 2+ months, I already went ahead and had half of my 288 limited edition order manufactured. Recently received, they are available for immediate shipment.

I also obtained small test quantities of my Call Of The Wild Collection items so the products and their packaging could be examined and recently received assurances the deliveries of any orders I place for them will occur within what I specified as an acceptable timeframe.

So shortly after the campaign comes to an end, pressing, packaging and shipping of the perks will begin.

Our goal is to have all of the perks delivered to campaign backers by mid-December.

While that schedule is aggressive and the timing will be tight, I believe it is achievable.
Because should the campaign prove to be so successful we will not during the desired timeframe be able to handle all of the embellishing in-house, I will contract Stahls' Contract Decorating Fulfillment Center for external assistance.
80 years experience, a reputation for providing the quickest turnaround times in the industry and an exclusive supplier to many professional sports leagues and licensed manufacturers, the center has been confirmed ready, willing and able to serve me/Elements Of Style, LLC as a dependable Plan B.

So while unexpected developments could conceivably result in the failure of some perks to be delivered in time to be presented as Holiday gifts, there are essentially no risks or insurmountable challenges likely to prevent successful completion of the proposed project.

My Story
I'm
Marcel, known to many as Mickey, M. I. T. educated owner of a value
engineering practice and
Bronx born and bred creator of NYC Wear and Gear, a gifts and
garments line that targets New Yorkers … and
others with style and/or attitude.
Feel
good interactions with fellow native New Yorkers I often encountered
while traveling extensively on business stateside and abroad are what
motivated me to introduce the line, which features items such kindred
spirits and I could wear or use to celebrate our roots and showcase
our shared civic pride. 

However while
achieving steadily increasing levels of appeal and acceptance in
general, items that bear the trademarked logo of my Bona Fide
New Yorker lifestyle brand, with the exception of caps, have received
a lukewarm reception from folks who like for the designs on their
garments to be significantly larger than sizes that can be
cost-effectively embroidered or who favor design finishes with
diverse looks and feels. 

So this campaign is to
raise funds sufficient for me to purchase two Hotronix heat presses
and certain accessories. 

The first, a 16” x 20”
unit capable of placing large versions of  my logo and other graphics
on a variety of garments (T-shirts, tank tops, jerseys, jackets,
hoodies, regular sweatshirts, sweatpants, etc.) and sundry
promotional products, as well as Converse Chuck Taylor All Stars or
other athletic footwear when outfitted with its special shoe platen
and 

the second, a cap-specific
model to enable placement on headwear (caps, hats, headbands, ear
warmers, visors, SoHoodies, etc.) full color digital transfer designs
that are not large but feature finishes, fine details and/or
gradients that simply cannot be done with embroidery.
Both presses produce
results with the durability of quality screen printing and support
the application of rhinestones and finishes with popular appearances
(3D/Puff, prism-like, glitter/sparkle, sheen, frosted, metallic,
mirror, safety/emergency:reflective and high-visibility neon, colors
that glow in the dark or change when subjected to UV light, etc.)
and/or the feel of a given material (suede, velvet, patent leather).
Your support of my campaign will enable me to invest in the two heat presses, do in-house embellishing of products that will enable me to fill small to medium size orders of customers who fall into the big & bold or diverse look & feel design camps and decorate test or show  garments with such designs which if they prove to be big sellers I will have done in large quantities by commercial screenprinting companies.
But that's not all. In addition to
increasing the NYC Wear and Gear goods embellishment options, I will
use the heat presses to place logos or other graphics on appropriate
items for some of the small high tech firms and other businesses with
which I am allied, as well as for friends who are photographers,
graphic or performing artists, organizers of reunions, or members of
school clubs or organizations, who not only lack the financial
resources of large companies but often require quantities less than
those at which screenprinting becomes economically attractive. 

The relationships I've been
cultivating and nurturing with custom screen printed transfer sheet specialists, who
instead of printing directly onto products will print my logos and
any other graphics I specify onto special release materials for
transfer to items of interest whenever I choose using the proposed
heat presses, and being able to operate the presses myself when
necessary, will enable me to handle special requirements or last
minute jobs of my friends/associates and at my discretion reduce or
even completely eliminate labor charges to permit them to still
proceed with projects even when their funds are especially
tight.
Also I'll be
positioned to produce creatively embellished pieces to sell and
secure funds to supplement my personal donations to 501(c)(3) non
profit organizations such as A Better Chance, AIDS Action Committee,
Baruch College, Bronx Museum Of The Arts, Brooks School, City Squash,
Harlem Children's Zone, Leukemia & Lymphoma Society,
Massachusetts Institute Of Technology, Massachusetts Prostate Cancer
Coalition, National Multiple Sclerosis Society and the Simpson
Street Development Association that I have supported or others I
might choose to support in the future.
And last but not
least, I will be able to provide students attending local colleges
with opportunities to make money working as part-time press operators
or through their own entrepreneurial endeavors marketing and selling
NYC Wear and Gear's heat press embellished items. 
So please back my project
and help make my proposed purchase of the two heat presses a reality
by selecting a perk at the support/contribution level with which you are
comfortable and then sharing word of this campaign with friends,
relatives, associates and anyone else you believe will be inclined to
do the same.
THANK YOU!
  Your Perks
 In exchange for your support and enabling me to raise the $3,000.00, all of which will be used to purchase the presses/associated equipment and cover campaign related fees,  you will receive the perks of your choice, be among the first to wear or use them and receive advance notice regarding NYC Wear and Gear's new products ... in particular any limited edition offerings.



Closely allied
and collaborating with FIT alumni and technologists focused on fashion related
innovation, look
for NYC Wear and Gear to in the future introduce products that
feature wearable electronics, exploit the special attributes of high
tech materials or via the use of patented technology and a
facilitating process provide custom tailored level, superb fit
garments that require no tailor visits.

you will be able to specify your choice from the following options.

Bona Fide New Yorker

story:
Alex is Riding for Alem's final stage to Rio..

Inspired by two of the most inspirational people I have met. My dad Ian Main, who passed away when I was 11 years old at the age of 38 and 31 year old Alem Mumuni, Ghana’s first ever Paralympic Cyclist. Two of life's most humble and compassionate people with a determination to always do their best and an incredible passion for cycling.

I need to raise £2500 to get Alem to the Rio 2016 Paralympic Games by June 12th 2016

What am I doing?

  • I have signed up to the L’Etape on 10th July 2016 which is a stage of the famous Tour de France and my dad’s favorite cycling event on earth! I however I have never done a cycle race in my life and commute for leisure, so this will probably be the hardest thing I will ever do. 
  • The race is 146km in one day starting in Megeve and finishing in Morzine. I will be faced with 4 big mountain climbs, totaling 3335m. Even writing about it makes me nervous! Last year only 5% of the entries were women and 1,000’s of people didn’t finish.

The story behind the ride

In 2012 at the age of 23 I accepted a role in Ghana to coach Alem Mumuni for the London 2012 Paralympic Games. Alem has poliomyelitis in one leg and rides his bike using his good leg. Against all odds and no funding, Alem qualified for the London 2012 Paralympic Games. Devastatingly, Alem contracted chicken pox in the village and was unable to compete in this time trial and road race. 

  • In 2013 Alem was ranked 2nd in the world for C2 Paracycling. His talent is endless but with little or no support from Ghana he is pretty much on his own.
  •  To date, we have raised over £10,217. This has enabled Alem to compete in 3 international competitions in Spain, California and South Africa where he scored vital points to achieve a world ranking. 
  • Alem is now ranked 27th in the world. 

Just recently we have had some fantastic news that Alem has qualified for the Games so now we are organizing his final competitions and training camp to prime him ready and raring with the best possible chance for Rio Paralympic Games.

 Alem now has the opportunity compete for Ghana’s first ever Paralympic medal!

What's my goal and what is the money going to be spent on?

We have partnered with the high performance training centre, Tenerife Top Training (T3), and their UK agents, TTT Sports Ltd, who organise athletic training camps. Alem will be able to gain the benefits of training at altitude, where the likes of superstars Bradley Wiggens and the Sky team train. T3 and TTT Sports have arranged an incredible deal which provides

  • 3 months all inclusive full board and training for just £780. Flights and visa for Alem are estimated to be £1600. I am looking to raise in total £2500 to cover the camp, flights and visa. 
  • All money donated will be going directly to get Alem2Rio campaign.


What if I succeed my target?

Any excess funds raised will be put good to use at our charity The Alem Foundation. This was originally set up by Alem and myself to support underprivileged children in Ghana.

To date we have delivered:

  • Education Scholarships to 33 children. Funds give them full primary education and healthcare.
  • Clean drinking water to over 70 families. Supplied each family with water purifying filters guaranteeing sustainable fresh drinking water.
  • Funded life changing surgery for two disabled children.

We have ambitious plans to help the children of Ghana in 2016 with a school redevelopment and water bore hole project currently in fundraising stage. If you want to learn more about these projects please refer to our website – www.alemfoundation.com

Important to note we are soon going to a fully registered charity so all donations with be entitled to gift aid soon. Furthermore, we are very interested in speaking to corporate donors who are interested in supporting Alem Foundation.

Thank you so much for your donation and remember a small amount of money can go a long way.
