story:
Update #3: One week left! New Perk!

We've come a long way with this campaign, and it's all thanks to you, our loyal supporters. Now there's just one week left and we've nearly reached our second goal. Help us out go with a bang!

We are happy to announce a brand new perk: Traveler

 

Receive a sling bag printed with the Volante Design logo. The bags, while not produced by Volante Design, feature a design style similar to what you would expect from Volante. 2 practical zipper pockets, a mesh water bottle pouch, and an adjustable strap make this bag excellent for everyday use.

 

Update #2: What happens now that we've reached our goal?

$15,000 was just the beginning. That was set as our goal because that is the bare minimum we needed to take this next step. Now that we are there, we can start working toward the fun stuff; the things that will really set us apart from other businesses.

If you've been following the campaign, you already know that we are raising money to be able to purchase software that is optimized for clothing pattern design. You also know that the 15k we've raised so far will fund the basic 2D Computer Assisted Design, or CAD, aspect of the program, and that the next step is some sort of 3D extension to the software. 

But what you might not understand yet is how the 3D software will affect Volante Design.

Basically, For Us:

3D rendered prototypes! - Rather than have to go through the process of making a pattern, cutting it out, cutting the fabric, sewing, and so on, we can make a pattern that will be automatically rendered as a 3D model (with fabric physics). This will save us a LOT of time, and allow us to make more new designs.

Real time pattern adjustment! - We'll be able to change the pattern and immediately see a 3D model reflecting those changes.

The two of those combined with the software we can afford now will allow us to change existing patterns much more quickly, speeding up workflow and helping us not waste time drawing on/cutting out more paper.

Basically, For You:


More new designs, faster than we've been able to before!

Easier to do experimental customization!

Better, more accurate custom fits!

We can be faster overall!

Stronger clothes, thanks to real time stress maps!

 

Want to know more?


It's quite simple; the extended software will allow us to create 3D virtual prototypes of each of our garments. As a small company, we run into the problem of not having the resources or workers to create new prototypes, because they are too busy working on current orders. With virtual prototyping, we can make tweaks and adjustments and be able to see what difference those changes will make, without having to put a hold on production.

There is a video on the Optitex main page that shows some of the advantages of having the full software package. Be forewarned, the video is done in the cheesiest way possible, but it gets the point across.

www.optitex.com

More important than that is how it will affect the Volante Design customer experience.

Imagine this:

An online store with the capability of showing you what you would actually look like in a particular garment.

Take, for example, the Kenway Jacket. Say you wanted to buy the Kenway, but didn't know which size would fit you best. Optitex is currently working on a system which will be able to be implemented in a webstore that will allow you to input your measurements, and the system will create a 3D avatar that fits those measurements. You would then be able to take your avatar and apply the Kenway to it. If you apply the size Large Kenway to it, the program will simulate how that size jacket would fit you. If it looks like that size isn't right, you can try on a different size.

Essentially what we are talking about is a virtual dressing room. Optitex has a basic mockup of how this might work on their site. Since the dressing room isn't quite ready yet, it does not support clothing sizes or colors yet, but again, it gets the point across.

Take a look at it here: Virtual Dressing Room Mockup

And that's just for the webstore! 

We also do a great deal of custom design and creations. With the virtual prototyping, we would be able to give our custom design clients a simulated prototype before cutting fabric, so that adjustments can be made without wasting time and materials.

And then there's color choices…

Volante Design prides itself in offering multiple color options for each of it's garments. The trouble we come to currently is that it can be difficult to visualize a color scheme for a particular jacket without seeing it. Virtual prototyping will enable us to create 3D versions of each of the main color schemes, as well as custom color schemes on the fly. So you'll never have to wonder if a purple and yellow Modern Assassin Armor will actually look good. 

It totally would, by the way.

That's it for now. The next goal ['C' above] is set for 25k. When we reach that, there will be another explanation for what comes after it. Keep sharing and helping in any way you can. 

Update #1: New Perk Unlocked!

Volante Assassin

You folks are amazing! In less than a week, we hit 15k, which was our "goal," but there’s still a long way to go before we’re done. Here’s a new perk, a t-shirt specially designed for the Volante Assassins out there who want to show their support, even when it’s too warm for a jacket. Some info about the shirt:

  • 4.1 oz. polyester jersey on front, 5.4 oz. polyester twill on back
  • Wicking and antimicrobial fabric
  • Sporty contrast stitched raglan sleeves
  • "C" logo on left sleeve

 

Volante Design: About Us

 
Volante Design is a new, independently owned clothing design company based in Northampton, Massachusetts. It was started a year and a half ago by Enzo Volante; he decided to build a world of fashion where ordinary people could feel extraordinary, and that's been his full time job ever since.
 
We draw inspiration from the amazing costumes you can find in comic books, video games, movies, anime, and so on to create jackets that are completely suitable for everyday street wear.
 
As Enzo likes to put it, "I try to straddle the line between 'ridiculous' and 'awesome,' with the intention of ending up at 'ridiculously awesome.'"

The entire operation is currently run out of a single room in Northampton, with three full time employees (including Enzo). To see the sort of work we do, check out the gallery, or go to our store, volantedesign.us, and our blog.
 
We've also been covered in popular online magazines like Kotaku and FashionablyGeek.

This sounds cool, what do you need?

As a small company with few employees, limited workspace, and limited funds, it's hard (impossible) to create excellent jackets for everyone (more than a few at a time) who wants them. It's extra difficult for Enzo to find time to create new redesigns and patterns, because everything is done painstakingly by hand on paper. This takes a lot of time, and time is at a premium for us.

But, I can't donate time through Paypal.

 This is where you come in! With your donations, Volante Design can take the next giant leap into the world of clothing design. Think about it this way: the Volante Design blog has about 5,500 followers. If 5,000 followers each gave $5, we would raise $25,000, which would cover not only the bare minimum we need, but also enable us to purchase the full software upgrade. What's this about software, you ask?

As a self-taught pattern designer, Enzo creates all his patterns by hand, cutting and splicing pieces of paper together with tape, painstakingly adjusting each edge of the paper to account for seam allowance. And while this method works in the small studio, it is very time consuming, not particularly accurate, and most importantly will not be accepted by a professional manufacturer for mass production. Manufacturers require digitally perfected patterns, which means we would have to scan (or digitize) our hard-copy patterns into a pattern design program, in order to optimize them for production.

There are companies out there that offer digitizing and optimization services which Volante Design could outsource to, but that can take several weeks, and runs the risk of losing valuable design nuances, due to the disconnect from the original creative mind behind the design. Therefore, it would be incredibly valuable for Volante Design to own the software and hardware for itself, so that we can create the best possible product, without having to rely on outside sources.

 

How much we need, and why:

First, a list of the prices, and below will be an explanation of what each item is and why it is important.

Pattern Digitizer: $2,685

Optitex PDS:

  • 2D: $9,700
  • 3D: +$10,000
  • Animation: +$2,500

= Total: $22,300

Plotter/Large Format Printer:

  • Small/4ft: ~$4,000
  • Larger/5+ft: ~$14,000

 

Why exactly is all that necessary, you ask?

Well, basically, the benefits of owning such pattern design software [PDS] are countless. We will be able to create a pattern, digitize it, and make adjustments, add seam allowance, create standard sizes and make instant custom size variations simply by plugging in a list of measurements. And that's just with the 2D software.

With the 3D software, we would be able to create 3D virtual prototypes, which will streamline the design process, and help minimize the number of sewn prototypes needed before a product is ready to be sold. The most important takeaway is that having the capability to create digital patterns in-house will drastically increase productivity, and reduce the amount of time between releasing new designs.

That's the skinny. Rather than fill this page with long, detailed descriptions of why each part of the software and hardware is important, we've decided to put all of that elsewhere. Click this link to read on: http://blog.volantedesign.us/post/39608298933

 

Ok, so what happens when we surpass our fundraising goal?

Once we have met our goal, any funds over the required amount for the full software package will go towards producing more garments for Express orders, as well as designing completely new styles. Every single dollar helps, and we will be eternally grateful for your contribution.

 

What sort of perks are we offering for your contributions?

No matter how much you can give, we want to show you that we appreciate your help.

  • Fan - $5: For five dollars, Enzo will give you a high five the first time you meet. Fist bumps are available as an alternative.
  • Minstrel - $25: Almost completely unrelated to Volante Design, but here's an example of what sort of thing to expect: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=se4Aek5X4CM
  • Artist - $50: Receive a high quality print of your favorite Volante Design illustration. When the illustrations were originally posted, they did not have backgrounds, these will be added to make the artwork more interesting for print.
  • VIP - $100: Once we have the ability to create patterns more quickly, we will be taking votes regularly as to which design should be developed next. Largely these votes will be hosted on the official blog, but once the general vote has narrowed it down, I will put the final decision to the VIP board through email. As a VIP member, you will be able to give reasons for your choice, and offer feedback. Enzo will read every response, and take them into consideration before choosing.
  • We Listen To You - $150: Enzo will do an entirely new illustration of the design of your choice. He will take your initial ideas into consideration, and work one on one to come up with a brand new design with you. This design may not become immediately available, but will be developed at a future date.
  • Messenger - $300: This perk refers to a completely new design from Volante: a messenger bag. The design for this bag has not yet been finalized, but it will be based on, and inspired by, the bag Desmond wears in the Assassin's Creed series. For reference, this bag can be seen here: http://volanteinspiration.tumblr.com/post/38849725735. More information will be posted as it is available.
  • Benefactor/Patron/Medici - $1k/$5k/$10k: With these perks, you will be able to propose your own wishes for a custom piece of clothing, and have it made just for you. You will take part in the design process, and be able to make sure you get the exact garment you want. The more you contribute, the more complex your design can be, or the better the materials used can be. If we raise enough for the 3D software, you will be able to see what the design will look like on you before the final piece is made, and make final adjustments. The Exclusive Plan refers to the amount of time before your design is made available for order to the public. So a 6 Month plan means for 6 months after the date you receive your garment, you will be only person who owns a garment of that design.
  • VIP Prime w/Patron/Medici: You have shown massive support for Volante Design, and deserve something special. VIP Prime status is undefined as yet, and will be discussed ona case-by-case basis, and will depend on what you want to be a part of in regards to the future of the business. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand if you cannot contribute at this time. Perhaps there is some other way to support the fund:

  • Share this page. Make some noise, via facebook, or twitter, or even tumblr.
  • Get the word out about Volante Design, use the share tools below to show your friends our blog/website/facebook. If they see what we do, they might become inspired to help out.

 

And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Update #3: One week left! New Perk!
We've come a long way with this campaign, and it's all thanks to you, our loyal supporters. Now there's just one week left and we've nearly reached our second goal. Help us out go with a bang!
We are happy to announce a brand new perk: Traveler

 
Receive a sling bag printed with the Volante Design logo. The bags, while not produced by Volante Design, feature a design style similar to what you would expect from Volante. 2 practical zipper pockets, a mesh water bottle pouch, and an adjustable strap make this bag excellent for everyday use.
 
Update #2: What happens now that we've reached our goal?
$15,000 was just the beginning. That was set as our goal because that is the bare minimum we needed to take this next step. Now that we are there, we can start working toward the fun stuff; the things that will really set us apart from other businesses.
If you've been following the campaign, you already know that we are raising money to be able to purchase software that is optimized for clothing pattern design. You also know that the 15k we've raised so far will fund the basic 2D Computer Assisted Design, or CAD, aspect of the program, and that the next step is some sort of 3D extension to the software. 
But what you might not understand yet is how the 3D software will affect Volante Design.
Basically, For Us:
3D rendered prototypes! - Rather than have to go through the process of making a pattern, cutting it out, cutting the fabric, sewing, and so on, we can make a pattern that will be automatically rendered as a 3D model (with fabric physics). This will save us a LOT of time, and allow us to make more new designs.
Real time pattern adjustment! - We'll be able to change the pattern and immediately see a 3D model reflecting those changes.
The two of those combined with the software we can afford now will allow us to change existing patterns much more quickly, speeding up workflow and helping us not waste time drawing on/cutting out more paper.
Basically, For You:
More new designs, faster than we've been able to before!
Easier to do experimental customization!
Better, more accurate custom fits!
We can be faster overall!
Stronger clothes, thanks to real time stress maps!
 
Want to know more?
It's quite simple; the extended software will allow us to create 3D virtual prototypes of each of our garments. As a small company, we run into the problem of not having the resources or workers to create new prototypes, because they are too busy working on current orders. With virtual prototyping, we can make tweaks and adjustments and be able to see what difference those changes will make, without having to put a hold on production.
There is a video on the Optitex main page that shows some of the advantages of having the full software package. Be forewarned, the video is done in the cheesiest way possible, but it gets the point across.
www.optitex.com
More important than that is how it will affect the Volante Design customer experience.
Imagine this:
An online store with the capability of showing you what you would actually look like in a particular garment.
Take, for example, the Kenway Jacket. Say you wanted to buy the Kenway, but didn't know which size would fit you best. Optitex is currently working on a system which will be able to be implemented in a webstore that will allow you to input your measurements, and the system will create a 3D avatar that fits those measurements. You would then be able to take your avatar and apply the Kenway to it. If you apply the size Large Kenway to it, the program will simulate how that size jacket would fit you. If it looks like that size isn't right, you can try on a different size.
Essentially what we are talking about is a virtual dressing room. Optitex has a basic mockup of how this might work on their site. Since the dressing room isn't quite ready yet, it does not support clothing sizes or colors yet, but again, it gets the point across.
Take a look at it here: Virtual Dressing Room Mockup
And that's just for the webstore! 
We also do a great deal of custom design and creations. With the virtual prototyping, we would be able to give our custom design clients a simulated prototype before cutting fabric, so that adjustments can be made without wasting time and materials.
And then there's color choices…
Volante Design prides itself in offering multiple color options for each of it's garments. The trouble we come to currently is that it can be difficult to visualize a color scheme for a particular jacket without seeing it. Virtual prototyping will enable us to create 3D versions of each of the main color schemes, as well as custom color schemes on the fly. So you'll never have to wonder if a purple and yellow Modern Assassin Armor will actually look good. 
It totally would, by the way.
That's it for now. The next goal ['C' above] is set for 25k. When we reach that, there will be another explanation for what comes after it. Keep sharing and helping in any way you can. 
Update #1: New Perk Unlocked!

Volante Assassin
You folks are amazing! In less than a week, we hit 15k, which was our "goal," but there’s still a long way to go before we’re done. Here’s a new perk, a t-shirt specially designed for the Volante Assassins out there who want to show their support, even when it’s too warm for a jacket. Some info about the shirt:

4.1 oz. polyester jersey on front, 5.4 oz. polyester twill on back
Wicking and antimicrobial fabric
Sporty contrast stitched raglan sleeves
"C" logo on left sleeve
 
Volante Design: About Us
 
Volante Design is a new, independently owned clothing design company based in Northampton, Massachusetts. It was started a year and a half ago by Enzo Volante; he decided to build a world of fashion where ordinary people could feel extraordinary, and that's been his full time job ever since.
 
We draw inspiration from the amazing costumes you can find in comic books, video games, movies, anime, and so on to create jackets that are completely suitable for everyday street wear.
 
As Enzo likes to put it, "I try to straddle the line between 'ridiculous' and 'awesome,' with the intention of ending up at 'ridiculously awesome.'"The entire operation is currently run out of a single room in Northampton, with three full time employees (including Enzo). To see the sort of work we do, check out the gallery, or go to our store, volantedesign.us, and our blog.
 
We've also been covered in popular online magazines like Kotaku and FashionablyGeek.

This sounds cool, what do you need?
As a small company with few employees, limited workspace, and limited funds, it's hard (impossible) to create excellent jackets for everyone (more than a few at a time) who wants them. It's extra difficult for Enzo to find time to create new redesigns and patterns, because everything is done painstakingly by hand on paper. This takes a lot of time, and time is at a premium for us.
But, I can't donate time through Paypal.
 This is where you come in! With your donations, Volante Design can take the next giant leap into the world of clothing design. Think about it this way: the Volante Design blog has about 5,500 followers. If 5,000 followers each gave $5, we would raise $25,000, which would cover not only the bare minimum we need, but also enable us to purchase the full software upgrade. What's this about software, you ask?
As a self-taught pattern designer, Enzo creates all his patterns by hand, cutting and splicing pieces of paper together with tape, painstakingly adjusting each edge of the paper to account for seam allowance. And while this method works in the small studio, it is very time consuming, not particularly accurate, and most importantly will not be accepted by a professional manufacturer for mass production. Manufacturers require digitally perfected patterns, which means we would have to scan (or digitize) our hard-copy patterns into a pattern design program, in order to optimize them for production.
There are companies out there that offer digitizing and optimization services which Volante Design could outsource to, but that can take several weeks, and runs the risk of losing valuable design nuances, due to the disconnect from the original creative mind behind the design. Therefore, it would be incredibly valuable for Volante Design to own the software and hardware for itself, so that we can create the best possible product, without having to rely on outside sources.
 
How much we need, and why:
First, a list of the prices, and below will be an explanation of what each item is and why it is important.
Pattern Digitizer: $2,685
Optitex PDS:

2D: $9,700
3D: +$10,000
Animation: +$2,500

= Total: $22,300
Plotter/Large Format Printer:

Small/4ft: ~$4,000
Larger/5+ft: ~$14,000

 
Why exactly is all that necessary, you ask?
Well, basically, the benefits of owning such pattern design software [PDS] are countless. We will be able to create a pattern, digitize it, and make adjustments, add seam allowance, create standard sizes and make instant custom size variations simply by plugging in a list of measurements. And that's just with the 2D software.
With the 3D software, we would be able to create 3D virtual prototypes, which will streamline the design process, and help minimize the number of sewn prototypes needed before a product is ready to be sold. The most important takeaway is that having the capability to create digital patterns in-house will drastically increase productivity, and reduce the amount of time between releasing new designs.
That's the skinny. Rather than fill this page with long, detailed descriptions of why each part of the software and hardware is important, we've decided to put all of that elsewhere. Click this link to read on: http://blog.volantedesign.us/post/39608298933
 
Ok, so what happens when we surpass our fundraising goal?
Once we have met our goal, any funds over the required amount for the full software package will go towards producing more garments for Express orders, as well as designing completely new styles. Every single dollar helps, and we will be eternally grateful for your contribution.


 
What sort of perks are we offering for your contributions?
No matter how much you can give, we want to show you that we appreciate your help.


Fan - $5: For five dollars, Enzo will give you a high five the first time you meet. Fist bumps are available as an alternative.

Minstrel - $25: Almost completely unrelated to Volante Design, but here's an example of what sort of thing to expect: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=se4Aek5X4CM


Artist - $50: Receive a high quality print of your favorite Volante Design illustration. When the illustrations were originally posted, they did not have backgrounds, these will be added to make the artwork more interesting for print.

VIP - $100: Once we have the ability to create patterns more quickly, we will be taking votes regularly as to which design should be developed next. Largely these votes will be hosted on the official blog, but once the general vote has narrowed it down, I will put the final decision to the VIP board through email. As a VIP member, you will be able to give reasons for your choice, and offer feedback. Enzo will read every response, and take them into consideration before choosing.

We Listen To You - $150: Enzo will do an entirely new illustration of the design of your choice. He will take your initial ideas into consideration, and work one on one to come up with a brand new design with you. This design may not become immediately available, but will be developed at a future date.

Messenger - $300: This perk refers to a completely new design from Volante: a messenger bag. The design for this bag has not yet been finalized, but it will be based on, and inspired by, the bag Desmond wears in the Assassin's Creed series. For reference, this bag can be seen here: http://volanteinspiration.tumblr.com/post/38849725735. More information will be posted as it is available.

Benefactor/Patron/Medici - $1k/$5k/$10k: With these perks, you will be able to propose your own wishes for a custom piece of clothing, and have it made just for you. story:
Short Summary

Geekling Designs was created in 2009 by two geeks who wanted some cool clothes for their daughter.  After noticing a rather lacklustre selection of witty and geeky designs for the pre-walking crowd, Geekling Designs was born.

All of our designs are inspired by geek and pop culture, including Star Wars, Harry Potter and Game of Thrones.  We started making baby bodysuits and have since expanded to offer awesome accessories such as crocheted hats, pacifier clips and even some geektastic maternity shirts for moms-to-be.

Along with our original designs, we also offer a custom order service.  From the initial sketches up to the finished product, we are able to tailor our products to the customer's tastes, whether it be a simple personalization, or a completely original design.

We'd love to further increase our offerings by purchasing a vinyl plotter and heat-press to be able to shorten production times on custom orders and be able to expand our product lines to include decals and stickers.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $1200 to purchase a vinyl plotter (cutter) and a professional heat press so that we can help reduce the time spent on producing custom orders.  Even if we do not receive the full $1200, any monies raised will be put towards the purchase of this equipment, so every penny helps!

 

 

**** For clothing & accessory perks, you have the option of choosing ANY of the current designs available through our Etsy store! *****

 

We think we have some awesome perks in exchange for your support!

$5 - A special coupon code for 25% off your next order

$10 - The $5 perk + a pacifier clip or hair clip of your choice

  

$25 - The $5 perk + a bodysuit or toddler shirt of your choice

 

$50 - The $25 perk + a crocheted hat of your choice

 

$75 - The $25 perk + an adult or maternity t-shirt of your choice

 

$100 - 2 bodysuits or toddler shirts, 1 adult shirt, 1 crocheted hat and a bib, hat or pacifier clip of your choosing! (Plus the $5 perk)

  

 

The Impact

We would be able to drastically reduce the amount of time and money spent on producing custom orders.  We would no longer need to charge a set-up fee so customers would be able to order personalized bodysuits and shirts at a reduced price.

With the plotter and heat press, we would also be able to offer vinyl decals and stickers, which would be a great addition to our current products.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this on Facebook and Twitter.  Even if you can't help financially, spreading the word helps too!

Become a Fan on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/geeklingdesigns

Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/geeklingdesigns

Visit our website:  http://www.geeklingdesigns.ca

or shop our Etsy store: http://www.geeklingdesigns.etsy.com


Thank you so much for taking the time to support us just by reading about our story!

story:
Please Purchase (Contribute Now) a Product here (A Perk) and help spread the message "Love Everybody Love Every Body!!"

A Little Bit about LéLé B

Born from our anthem "Love Everybody Love Every Body!!" At LéLé B we believe that every girl should love herself, the body she lives in, and feel authentic in every way possible. All shapes, sizes, and spirits please come join us. Our shared journey starts here.

Started as the brain child of award winning beauty product developer Kym Wechsler, She wanted to do more then just create another must have beauty product. Over the past three years she has worked to develop this lifestyle beauty brand. By focusing on all different ways of spreading the message "Love Everybody Love Every Body!!" we have arrived at the collection of 17 beauty products as well as all the brand messaging accessories. Where do young women turn to for love and acceptance? From now on they can turn here. We will have live weekly Chat sessions with Dr. Victoria who will teach us all better ways to Love Our Bodies and Love Each Other. 

We are starting a revolution, and we are so excited to have you join us! Together we will change the way young women see themselves and each other.

Thanks to each of you!!!!! We will be using the funds raised here to purchase all of the LéLé B Brand Accessories and to create an awesome webite where we will sell products that will help spread the LéLé B "Love Everybody Love Every Body!!" and our anthem.

   

B Whoever You Can B and Give Whatever You Can

While we have the funds to make the beauty products, we need your help to build the branding apparel and accessories portion of LéLé B. Because we know that this is the most powerful way to spread the message. Although we have won many awards in the beauty industry, the rest is all pretty new for us. So we've teamed up with some pretty cool companies (Chico Bag to make our 99% private labeled recyled bags, Alternative Apparel for all our clothing including our beanies and scarves). What else do you think we need to spread the word??? Please share with us your insight. How do we become better, stronger, and more creative? Please let us know at social@luvleleb.com 

 

B Impactful

Each small step we take will make a difference. Spreading the word with our bumper stickers helps pass the love along to the car behind you. Our Message-band bracelets are a friendly reminder to love ourselves and the one right next to us. Wear a LéLé B attitude T-shirt and your favorite It's The Balm fragrance. When people tell you how great you smell just tell them, "Thank you! I'm wearing my favorite LéLé B It's The Balm fragrance. I'm The Balm and so are you!" ;)

      

 

B Supportive

Everybody can help by spreading the message. This will lead everybody to love each other a little more. Tell your friends, your neighbors, the person behind you waiting for coffee, that co-worker that no one likes, everyone, and you just might make their day. 

        

Follow @LuvLeLeB on your favorite social media for we will Be wherever you will Be!!

         

B Extraordinary

P.S. We would love to spread the LéLé B message to everyone everywhere. To go Talk to the ladies on The Talk. To share our point of View on The View. Kelly and Michael are the perfect example of every size, shape, and spirit. We know Nancy and Maria would both rock a LéLé B attitude T-shirt. The cast of Today can ask who will you B Today Happy? Sassy? Artistic? Fierce? Good Morning America it's another day to remember to Love Everybody. Above all, there is one women who stands for so many of our B Statements: B Fun, B Free, B Silly, and always B just who you were meant to B and that's Ellen. So if anyone out there can help us spread the message on any of these or other awesome shows, please just let us know at social@luvleleb.com for we would love to share the message with everyone everywhere.

P.S. We would love to spread the LéLé B message to everyone everywhere. To go Talk to the ladies on The Talk. To share our point of View on The View. Kelly and Michael are the perfect example of every size, shape, and spirit. We know Nancy and Maria would both rock a LéLé B attitude T-shirt. The cast of Today can ask who will you B Today Happy? Sassy? Artistic? Fierce? Good Morning America it's another day to remember to Love Everybody. Above all, there is one women who stands for so many of our B Statements: B Fun, B Free, B Silly, and always B just who you were meant to B and that's Ellen. So if anyone out there can help us spread the message on any of these or other awesome shows, please just let us know at social@luvleleb.com for we would love to share the message with everyone everywhere.

story:
Short Summary

We are asking for your support to launch KidMacho.com, which is one of the very few sports apparel companies geared towards young athletes:

  • We are family owned and operated in St. Louis, MO.
  • Your contribution will help us expedite this exciting brand launch.
  • We have donation options ranging from $10 to $500 on the right side of this page.
What You Get
  • You will receive FREE STL Golf Card(s) and FREE STL Dining Card(s), as well as FREE $10 off $30 Golfsmith coupon(s), for each donation that you make!  
  • It's that simple.

story:
POCKETSQUARE PERFECTION... is a new device that revolutionizes Men’s fashion "as the tie clip does the tie".  It is the first and only device that holds one’s pocketsquare securely in place.  As our name suggest, our focus is to provide a new innovative accessory that allows the well-dressed man to fashion their own unique, creative style with respect to the folding of your handkerchief/pocketsquare. And yes INDIEGOGO, it is made right here in America.  

How It Works...


Perfecting the Pocketsquare...

Pocketsquare Perfection securely locks your pocketsquare in place, so no more pinning, stuffing, or having to wear cardboard contraptions in your suit or jacket pockets. 


The Device

Our mission for this campaign is to raise the funding goal we set and inevitably start a "Pocketsquare Movement" in promoting this new accessory for the modern gentleman.  We have formulated our design concept and after creating and testing various prototypes, we came up with a good CAD model to began to sample with several manufacturers.   Then we finally narrowed it down to our succinct, and sleek design pictured below.  We plan to get this product made and packaged and fulfill the first run orders throughout the campaign.  My team and I have worked on the project extensively going on two years and Indiegogo will be the platform we use to begin this movement. 


With your help, we plan to meet our suppliers and manufacturers minimum orders to ultimately make this affordable leather product available for all who wear suits, sport-coats, and blazers.  We want to be able to meet the demands of our customers but most important we want to keep this product affordable and made in America.

Our niche in the fashion industry is that we teach so many different ways to fold with use of the device via our color pictorials included on the packaging, our 1-minute tutorial videos for each fold, and our free app for smart devices that we are in the process of designing.  In addition we will have customer rewards and discounts online, as well as a current style and fashion blog dedicated to Men's fashion.  With the funds raised we basically want to make our website a one-stop-shop for all your pocketsquare needs. 

The Classic Mad Men Fold...

The product is great for everyday use, work, business casual, church, formals, weddings, black-tie events, and more.

What started out of necessity has turned into a passion. Fashion is important to all men and wearing a pocketsquare is simply one of the easiest ways to elevate your style.  Like most Men we strive on “Machismo “ and set the standards through our expression in the way we dress.  As true fashion aficionados, we strive for that classic look, but sometimes we choose to go with a little additional flair. 


For events such as formals and weddings, it is a must-have.  It provides that consistent and uniform look for all groomsmen and just men in general.


What We Need & What You Get

Our manufacturer said that since the holiday season is upon us we have a 6-week lead-time for manufacturing.  That means that we have to be as quick as possible.  We have secured a credit source so that as soon we hit our Indiegogo goal we can start production, cutting down the time between the end of our Indiegogo campaign, and the time everyone gets their packaged devices.  We want to make sure everyone has plenty of time to get everything ready and delivered for the holidays.

Included in the the device is a 100%silk, handwoven, starter pocketsquare. Contingent upon the pledge option, you can get either the black or white square

In addition to its fine build and quality craftmanship, these devices are truly unique and provide an answer to an age-old problem men have faced since the common suit and accessories evolved.  Each unit has a very special and unique lining with different patterns and designs ideally delineating it into a special accessory in its own right.




With the various reward options and all of the customization available, ideally all you need is just one device.  However, you can have a few just like the average man has multiple cufflinks and tie-clips.    Even tho it is hidden discreetly within the pocket, it is still a great conversational piece in manliness.


The Impact

TIES FOR TEENS is our youth initiative we have started in which through donations of either new or older ties and bow-ties, we will collect them via an on-going yearly drive and then in turn donate them to male adolescents at various schools in the greater Dallas and Nashville communities.  With that being stated we will enlist volunteers in the community to come in during a particular program setup thru the schools and administration to teach young men about style, and fashion, but more importantly, "how to tie a tie"!

We teach sound, fundamental principles through our quick seminars simply about professionalism, how to shake hands, preparation for their first interviews, and just basic essentials important in the development of male adolescents.  

A small portion of our proceeds (5%) will go toward this worthy cause.

 



Pocketsquare Perfection is an ideal birthday, holiday, special occasion, or even Christmas gift for all Sons, Fathers, Brothers, Uncles, and Grandfathers...all Men and Women who choose to elevate their style to the next level and simply "Dress how one wants to be addressed".


Its sleek design will not bulge but allows you to fashion your square however you like to.  You even can wear the device and square with a vest with a pocket and even a buttoned-down collared shirt. 

We urge you to support this project so that you can truly achieve your own Pocketsquare Perfection and take your fashion and style to the next level.



Our team has done its best to mitigate the risks and challenges for this project.

We have a working prototype and can proudly state that the devices are outstanding.  Over the past year we have done extensive research and allowed a few people from within to test out the devices and now we are ready to launch this brand and first product to the world.  

Having worked with our manufacturer over this past year and seeing the quality work and craftmanship, we can vouch for their quality and reliability.  We are trying to adhere to our production schedule and are confident in our suppliers and vendors for both the inputs and manufacturing to ultimately get you Pocketsquare Perfection after a successful campaign.  

 


We will release a smaller device custom made for a women and children later this fall (the p2 mini 2.0).  In addition to that, we will carry our own line of pocketsquares, but first Indiegogo lets get the device into the hands of all men, all women, all kids...all people who wear suits and blazers.  Now come on guys, lets make Pocketsquare Perfection a brand for the ages. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please help spread and  get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Spread the word and video link to all men and or women who wear suits, sportcoats, jackets, blazers, vests, and even button down shirts.
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
I'm Stuart Berman, and I believe the time has come to reinvent the classic cotton short. That's why, I have developed the PERFECT all day short.

OUR SHORTS ARE MORE THAN REGULAR COTTON SHORTS

Our 100% Cotton Twill, "Morrison" Short, dries faster than regular cotton shorts. The Morrison short is the perfect all day, anywhere short. Take a bike ride, hike, play golf, walk around town.

I have designed and engineered a 100% cotton short that reacts like a moisture wicking synthetic fiber. I set out to remake the classic khaki short using modern day technology. Don't you think it is time to bring your wardrobe into the 21st century?

I searched the market for a 100% cotton short that would react like a synthetic. I quickly realized, I would need to make the material from scratch.

Supporting Our Project

 

 

Thank you for supporting our project and giving me the chance to bring my shorts to market. I appreciate your generosity!

 

 

I need to raise $10,000! 

This will be used to create the fabric, make production samples, and complete the first full production run---the money is not for salaries.

How far is Ben Kona in the development and production process?

 

  • I have made several prototypes to ensure the right size, shape, and fit.
  • The supply chain is all set up. From the fabric to the final product.
  • I have tested the fabric in and out of the water.

 

If I can raise over $100,000, I will begin developing a line of women’s shorts/pants.

How can you help make this project happen? Here are several ways:

 

  • LIKE US on Facebook and invite your friends: www.facebook.com/benkona You'll be surprised by the effect this can have.
  • Spread the word. Please tell everyone you know why you think this project is interesting.
  • Most of all, please donate to this project by "Contributing to this Project".

 

 

 

Benefits of Ben Kona Shorts:

 

 

 

  1. Perfect all day shorts.
  2. Made from natural materials.
  3. Side seam pockets - great for cell phones.
  4. Fabric developed and made in the USA.
  5. Fabric colors exclusive to Ben Kona.
  6. Great for Boaters...Golfers...Hikers...Fishermen...Active Lifestyles....
  7. Side seam cinch feature.

 

 

 

 


Technical Specs

 

 

 

 

 

Material: 6.5oz 100% Cotton Twill

Inseam: 9.5"

Waist Band: Fitted with belt loops and side seam cinch tabs

Pockets: 2 side seam pockets with button closure, 2 back pockets - one with button closure

Closure: Zipper front, inside and outside button closure

Use: Everyday, casual, golf, hiking, fishing, bike riding, boating, travel, and swimming

Colors: Sonora, Maltese, Nantucket, Tobago, Cypress, and Basic Black

Sizes: 28, 30, 32, 34, 36, 40, 42 (Our sizes are comparable to other shorts on the market.)

 


 

Sizes available: 28, 30, 32, 34, 36, 38, 40, 42

 

 



Who is Stuart Berman?

 

 

I am founder Stuart Berman, and I am no stranger to men’s fashion. During my mid-20's, I launched Stuart Andrew, a men’s luxury loungewear/sportswear company. I sold part of my collection at upscale retail stores such as Saks Fifth Avenue and Harrod’s of London, and was featured in the Saks Fifth Avenue Christmas Catalogue, as well as trade publications and magazines. I have experience in all aspects of the design process, from initial conception to working with pattern makers to sample development to full production runs.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Want a FREE pair?

 

Email us at info@benkona.com and I will let you know how you can get one.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

I want to keep our relationship going!

 

 

Please follow us on:

 

Facebook

www.facebook.com/benkona

Twitter

https://twitter.com/BenKona

Pinterest

www.pinterest.com/benkona

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

I want to THANK:

 

 

Al Spoler - video development and production        Vickie Gray Images -  great photos

Alexander Wright - music composer                       Maryland Center of Fashion Design

Ella Pritsker                                                             Jenelle McCleary at Jurevicious

Rena Wilensky - social media                                 Baltimore Bicycle Works

Friends and Family                                                  William Smithline 

Nicole Lovelace Gordon

 

 

 

 

 

FAQs:

When will my shorts arrive?

I'm targeting a Mid April delivery for all orders. I'm confident I will meet this timeline as we have been working with our manufacturing partners and have finalized our patterns and designs. 

When do I get to pick my size and color? 

I will contact you once the campaign has been completed, so you can pick your desired size and color. If you have anymore questions, feel free to email me anytime at info@benkona.com

Can I give more than the perk amount? 

Of course you can! You are free to give more than the perk amount on any perk. By picking a certain perk, you are letting us know the amount of shorts you want at this time. However, if you believe in me and want to give me a bit more, it would be greatly appreciated. I thank you for your additional generosity in advance.

What if I have trouble checking out and paying for my shorts?

Indiegogo is here to help. If you have trouble paying please reach out to Indiegogo and let them know about the difficulty you are having to make a contribution. Please email them at their Customer Happiness team at support@indiegogo.com. Please CC us in the email at info@benkona.com

 

What are most of the moisture wicking shorts made out of today?

Currently most shorts on the market, which claim to be moisture wicking are produced from petrochemicals. Petrochemicals are chemicals made from crude oil and natural gas. The chief fibers manufactured from petrochemicals include nylon, polyester, acrylic, and olefin.

Will they shrink?

The fabric is 100% cotton and over the next few years may minimally after being routinely washed. Your shorts should fit you for years to come, as long as you stay the same size.

Any special washing or drying instructions?

As far as washing - wash in cold water, gentle cycle with like colors, only non-chlorine bleach if needed.

Dryer - REALLY IMPORTANT - Do Not Use DRYER SHEETS with our fabric. Tumble dry low and warm iron if needed.

What if I do not like them or they do not fit right?

This is unlikely. That said though, I stand by my product 100%, so if for any reason you aren't happy with your Ben Kona shorts just reach out to me at info@benkona.com. I’ll arrange for an exchange or full refund/return.

story:
What is Diario de una Couturier

Diario de una Couturier is a small fashion brand created in Barcelona (Spain) and Berlin (Germany) on 2012. The brand creates garments for fashionable and trendy women. All our designs are handcrafted in small ateliers in Europe and are eco-friendly, everything we produce is made using sustanaible yarns such as natural cotton yarns, eco-friendly linen and are hand dyed with natural plants.

For us, it is very important to create simple and trendy designs on a responsable way, impulsing the economy of small ateliers, suppliers and at the same time small shops.

In fact, Diario de una Couturier pretends to be something more than a fashion brand, it is a way to understand a new kind of economy, a more respectful one. 

We have launched this campaign to create a website for our brand.

  • We have calculated we need around 2500$ in order to develop a website, hire a photographer and a graphic designer.   
  •  At the same time, with this money will also create prototypes of the new summer collection
  • All people who are involved with the process will receive weekly updates and they will get to know how this little dream comes true.


With your help we can develope a proper site, work with good professionals and develope new designs collaborating with small suppliers. Our goal is to work  also on a quite big collection of garments using good fabrics and  paying fair wages to our suppliers.

Since we started our fashion brand we have been selling in stores in Barcelona and Berlin. Now with the website we can reach more people worldwide.

Thank you very much for your time and we are open to all your suggestions.

Here are our social networks.

www.diariodeunacouturier.com

www.facebook.com/diariodeunacouturier

www.instagram.com/diariodeunacouturier

With your help we can develope a proper site, work with good professionals and develope new designs collaborating with small suppliers. Our goal is to work  also on a quite big collection of garments using good fabrics and  paying fair wages to our suppliers. Since we started our fashion brand we have been selling in stores in Barcelona and Berlin. Now with the website we can reach more people worldwide.Thank you very much for your time and we are open to all your suggestions.Here are our social networks.www.diariodeunacouturier.comwww.facebook.com/diariodeunacouturierwww.instagram.com/diariodeunacouturier
